late wyte grace eſpeciall haue gyuen priuilege vnto well beloued ſeruant thomas berthelet maner perſon within • ealme durynge naturall lyfe ſayde thomas ſhall printe maner bokes ſo euer ſayd ſeruant ſhal prynt fyrst ſhall prynt agayne vpon men correction ſame within ſpace ſyxe yeres nexte enſuynge pryntynge euery 〈◊〉 boke ſo printed ſayde ſeruant wherfore woll commaunde ye none preſume prynte ſayde bokes durynge tyme oure priuilege ye intende eſchewe diſpleaſure moste excellent prince ovr moste redoubted ſoueraygne lorde kynge henry viii kynge englande fraunce defender faythe lorde irelande supreme heed erthe immediately vnder christe churche englande humble faythefull ſeruaunt thomas elyot knyght deſyreth perfite felicitie trvely euer haue bene opynion mooſte noble moſte puiſſaunt moſte vertuouſe prynce royall aſtate kynge erth next vnto god men moſte honoured loued feared incomparable degree facion man hauynge free vſe reaſon beholdynge eien diſpoſition moſte wonderfull ſette diuine prouydence thynges aboue v aboute v vndernethe v ſondry alternation tyme wyll denye thoſe thynges one principall ruler moderatour whoſe eternall ſapience thynges ben gouerned vnto office gouernance generall conſent al people one name appropried although diuerſitie langages letter ſyllables oftentymes chaunged yet worde ſpoken hath one ſignification implieth moche kinge englyſhe may appere rede holy ſcripture marke howe often god callid kinge alſo prophetes ſo frequently name hym ouer paynim beinge onely ladde naturall affection callyd iupiter whome aboue goddis 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 reſerued power vniuerſall kynge goddis men ſaythe may greatter name gyuen vnto hym whome ſuppoſed gyuer lyfe vnto creature whiche example ſimilitude diuine office men dyd attribute vnto ſoueraygne gouernours excellent denomination calling ſemblably kynges aſſigning cōmune diſtribution iuſtyce wherby people vnder gouernaunce ſhulde kepte preſerued quiete lyfe exercyſed beſtiall appetite paſſed forth partes honeſtie fynally ſhuld god rewarded immortalitie wel conſydred ſhall men apparant whiche rebell agaynſt kynges ennemies god wyll confounders naturall order prouidence aboue thinges haue mooſte admiration maieſtie whiche verye kynges raygnyng iuſtice whan conſyder therin ſemeth thynge ſupernaturall may ſpoken without derogation vnto goddis honour diuine influence ſparke diuinitie whiche late appered behelde grace ſyttyng throne royal aſtate ſupreme heed churche englande nexte vnder christ deſciſion condemnation pernicious errours moſte deteſtable heretyke iohn̄ nicolſon callyd alſo lambert whyche tyme hyghneſſe excellently tunge penne expreſſe declared royall perſone perfite image kyngely maieſtie compacte theſe excellent quality trewe religion sapience iuſtice mercy men reioycinge manifeſte moſt honorable declaration euangelicall faythe meruaylynge fulmination moſte vehement argumentes procedyng hyghnes confutation abhomynable hereſyes extollynge iuſte reprehencions peruerſe opinion interpretation arrogant maſters ſaid lambert whoſe writynges owne propre wytte truſted hyghneſſe trewely alledged agaynſte hym playne context holy ſcripture determinate ſentence holy great lerned doctours inioyenge alſo well gracis mooſte wonderfull pacyence longe ſuſtayninge folyſhe tediouſe obiections ſayde lambert alſo moſt chriſtian charitie mouynge exhortynge ſo ſtubborne heretike moſt gentyll perſwaſible langage recant forſake myſcheuouſe hereſies maieſtie true louynge ſubiectes beholdynge herynge ſpirite god ſpeakyng enoynted kynge myniſter elected ioy ſo replenyſhed whan deſyred expreſſe eche comforte whiche receyued ſame comforte ſuche importaunce mought none otherwyſe declared abundance teares ſent theyr eyen vnſpekable gladnes ouer preſence whyche kynges minyſter inferiours vnto amplification power callyd naturall contayned well wytte ſenſes force puiſſance corporall membres confirmation wherof howe many men haue ben knowen whyche er haue attayned familyar acquayntaunce kynges haue bene demed ſome meane wytte knowlege ſome baſe courage proweſſe whiche afterwarde haue exceded wytte courage men expectation fynally bene men allowed honourable notable perſonages wonderfull maieſtie royall perſon moſt gracious ſouerayn lorde haue ſelfe ſelfe late founde meruaylous experience yere paſſed beganne dictionarie declaryng latine engliſhe wherin vſed lyttell ſtudy beinge occupied neceſſarye buſynes whiche letted exacte labour ſtudy requiſyte makynge perfyte dictionarie whyles printyng vneth half deale performed hyghnes informed therof reportes gentyll maiſter antony denny wyſedome diligence worthily callyd highneſſe priuie chamber wyllyam tildiſley keper gracis lybrarie mooſte ſpecially recommendation moſt honourable lorde crumwell lorde priuie ſeale fauourer honeſtie next highneſſe chiefe patron vertue cunnyng conceyued labour good expectation declaryng moſte noble beneuolent nature fauouryng wyll well occupied hyghneſſe preſence dyuers noble men commendynge myne enterpriſe affirmed wolde erneſtely trauayle therin highnes well excellent counſaile ſuche bokes grace lacked wold therin ayde wordes confeſſe receiued newe ſpirite ſemed wherby founde forthwith augmentation myn vnderſtandynge ſo moche iuged whiche writen worthy come gracis preſence addition wherfore incontinent cauſed printes ceſſe beginninge letter lefte paſſed forth laſt letter diligent ſtudy done efteſones returned fyrſt letter ſemblable diligence performed temenant whiche proceding well perceyued though dictionary ben gathered one yet netheleſſe eche ar omitted ſome latin wordes interpreted bokes whiche order preceded feſtus hath manye whiche varro analogi nonius hath ſome whiche feſtus lacketh neſtor toke nat founde bothe tortellius ſo abundant diligent laurentius valla wrate wordes called elegancies wherin vndoubtedly excellent perottus cornucopie dyd omitte almoſt none written wordis compounde compendiouſe fryere calepine augmented nothyng amended rather appaired perottus ſtudiouſely gathered nebreſſenſis well lerned diligent appereth ſome wordes declareth latin bicauſe dictionarie wordes expounde ſpainyſhe tunge whiche nat vnderſtand nat hym ſhewe myn opinion budeus exact triall natiue ſence wordes aſwell greke latine aſſuredly right cōmendable moſte occupied conference phraſis bothe tunges whiche compariſon fewe wordes dyuers men haue written ſondry annotation commentary olde latine author among alſo diſcorde expoſitions whan conſydred attached horrible feare remembryng dangerous enterpriſe ſo ſmal reputation lernyng compariſon haue reherſed well difficultie true expreſſynge lyuely ſence latine wordes alſo importable labour ſerching expending diſcuſſing ſentences ancient writer premeditation abated courage deſperation euen hand rent al piece written nat beames royal maieſtie entred harte remembraunce comforte whiche grace lately receyued wherwith ſpirite reuyued hath ſet vp ſayle good courage vnder grace gouernance highneſſe myn onely mayſter ſtyrer ſhyppe good fortune entred goulfe diſdaynous enuie hauynge fyniſhed tyme ſymple dictionarie wherin dare affirme may founde thouſande mo latine wordes togither one dictionarie publyſhed royalme tyme whan fyrſte began write commentarie almoſt two yeres paſſed beſide conference phraſes fourmes ſpeakynge latin engliſhe haue alſo added proper termes belongynge lawe phiſike name diuers herbes knowen among v alſo good number fiſhes founden wel occean riuers moreouer ſondrie poyſis coyne meaſures ſometyme vſed among auncient romaynes grekes hebrues whiche knowlege reders hiſtories oration tullie alſo holy ſcripture bokes auncient phiſitions ſhall founde pleaſant alſo commodiouſe haue omitted prouerbes callyd adagia quicke ſentences whiche thought neceſſarie remembraunce moche partely negligence begynnynge partly vntrue information truſted alſo moche truſt calepine ſome fautes may founden dilygent redynge therfore moſt humbly beſeche excellent maieſtie hyghneſſe ſhall happen doubte one worde fyrſte parte warke perchance lacke worde whiche maieſtie ſhall happen rede good author maye lyke grace repayre incontinente vnto ſeconde parte whiche myn addition ſekyng ſame worde letter wherwith begynneth truſtynge veryly highnes ſhall ſatisfied moche haſte made printyng ſome letter may happen lacke ſome ſette wronge place ortography nat truely obſerued therfore haue put thoſe fautes table folowing preface wherby may eaſily corrected done truſte god manne ſhall fynde cauſe reiect boke rather thankefully take good wyll labour gyuynge maieſtie mooſte hartye thankes chiefe author therof whoſe gracious meanes menne beinge ſtudious may vnderſtande better latine tunge ſyxe monethes mought haue doone afore thre yeres withoute perfyte inſtructours whyche many ſuche eaſy come cauſe nede reherſe ſens one declared booke called gouernour whiche viii yeres paſſed dydde dedicate vnto hyghneſſe parte render moſt humble thankes vnto maieſtie good eſtimation grace retayneth poore lerning honeſtie promyſynge therfore highnes duryng lyfe naturall ſhall faythfully employe power wytte body ſerue truely maieſtie euery thynge wherto mooſte excellent iudgement ſhall thynke ſeruyce conuenient neceſſary meane tyme alway bounden ſeruant ſhal hartily pray vnto god proſpere hyghenes vertuouſe procedynges grauntynge alſo maieſtie may longe raigne ouer v incomparable comforte ioye naturall louynge ſubiectes amen tho eliota eqves lectoribvs vere doctis etsi nihil dvbito de vestro candore prudentia ac benignitate lectores candidiſſimi metus tamen liuoris alieni uehementer cogit ut huius operis principio uos aggrediar praeoccupatione quadam non tamen artificioſa ſed per quam ſimplici ac uerecunda qua ſolum erratula perpauca nimirum deprecando morſus inuidorum qui nuſquàm non ſunt facilius euitarem noſtis optumi uiri quam periculoſo certamine li adhuc pendeat inter huius aetatis medico de herbarium qua hercle ut nihil extet humanae ſaluti conducibilius ſi probe cognoſcatur ita nihil penè deterius aut magi noxium ſi quic quam ea male intelligendo quod lectori futurum ſit fraudi perperam committatur quod cum ipſe cognorim alioqui cupidus redigendi ho cōmentarios quorumcun que uerborum quae apud latino authores reperiantur ſenſus integros ac genuinos coepi cum quibuſdam herbariis ac pharmacopolis agere quos exiſtimaueram ea per quam gnaros fuiſſe ac perdiligentes ut ſtirpium non ſolum nomina uerum etiam figuras ipſas mihi ſcribenti ſuppeditarent homines uel improbe ſuam ignorantiam diſſimulantes uel ut mihi imponerent quod magi exiſtimo turpiter mentiētes alias figuras alia que nomina mihi praebuerūt quā earundē herbarū fuiſſe quas ego noſſe cupiebam poſtea diligentius inueſtigando per meipſum comperi quo factum eſt ut ab deluſus uel potius proditus aliquot herbas ac arbores aliena fide male deceptus huic dictionario ſub falſis nominibus inſeruerim quod tandem cum ex ſolidioris doctrinae uiris ſero propemodum conſultis tum ex inquiſitione perdiligenti tam libris dioſcoridis et galeni quam ipſis ſtyrpibus iā uiſis ac multo penitius conſyderatis deprehendiſſem adeo tantae negligentiae certe poenituit ut eo nomine tot menſiū labores ut mihi uidebatur inaniter exhauſtos flammis conſumpſiſſem ni potentiſſimi ac longe ſapientiſſimi principis noſtri henrici octaui regis angliae numen interpellaſſet cui meam fidem perficiundo hoc negotio paulo ante obſtrinxeram facturum igitur ſatis exiſtimabam uobis ueſtri que ſimilibus uiris uti que bonis aeque que doctis ſi tabellam appendicem huic epiſtolae herbarum uocabula uel perperam interpretata uel non ſatis cognita diligenter coegero quo minore cum periculo lectores quicquid mihi deciderit imprudēti reſarcire poſſint abeſt enim quam plurimum ut huiuſce rei quic quam pudeat cum manibus tractentur cottidie libri doctiſſimorum hominum tertium aut quartum recogniti nouis que additionibus iterum que iterum lucem aediti quod hercle cur mihi tantum non liceat ne que moribus ne dū legibus ullus quiſquam praeiudicauerit sed mihi obiicient aemuli multa quidem uerba quae apud calepinum reperiantur uel à ſponte praetermiſſa uel mihi nimium feſtinanti ſtolide dilapſa neutrum confitebor hercle nam cum primum ſtatuiſſem dictionarium latino anglicum ita iam lubet rei nouae nouum nomen effingere pro quodam meo nepote cōficere animo tum erat ne que plureis graecas dictiones aggerere quam quae uideri poſſent ualde neceſſariae ad eos authores intelligendum qui latine ſcribentes clariſſimi reputantur igitur non alia graeca uocabula deſumpſi mihi quā ea quae uel ciuitatem receptae ut dicere ſolent locum quempiam apud probatum aliquem authorem adornaſſent aut maiorem copiam aut ſenſum illuſtriorem praebuiſſent caetera quaecun que penis huiuſmodi authores uel nu quam reperta uel ab ii ipſis circumſcripta ne meam operam depingendis chartis nimium otioſis imprudenter luderem libenter praetermiſi quod ſcirem graecas literas noſce cupientibus aliorū librorum quos lexica uocant haud minorem copiam extare nec mihi duo paries de una fidelia dealbare admodum uacabat nam quid per deum immortalem arrogantius dici poſſit quid equidem ſtultius quam latino dictionario ex uerbis graecis aceruos ingentes colligere miſcellaneas que cōſarſinare cum ad rem literariam plaera que nihil faciant imo nonnum quam officiant cum inquirentem ſedulo latinam aliquam dictionem diu •• u quam par ſit retineant deni que praetermiſi nimia uetuſtate iam obſoleta uocabula quae terentii plauti que uenerandam antiquitatem longe praecedere aut plebeiorum ſordes nimium olere uideantur tum quod authores quibus uſui fuerunt eiuſmodi uoces nu quam extent tum quod nulla latine loquentibus utiles plurimum ſtylo puritati que ſermonis officere uehementer poterint si quis obſcoena uocabula deſyderet quibus iacentem uenerem inter legendum ſuſcitare queat alios dictionarios conſulat meū que contemnat hoc nomine ſi lubet quod eiuſcemodi uocibus careat noueram humani ſenſus quantum fuerint ſemper ad incendium prompti ſi deliteſcentem igniculum ex laſciuiuſculis uerbulis uel modicè delibauerint ſciebam quam auidi ſint homines tam foede ac demū poenitendae uoluptatis illecebris animos perluendi quā praecipites fuerīt ad exequendū quod libido ſuaſerit praeterea non ignorabā ipſam venerem non tantopere ſolicitatam omnino quieſcere leuioreſ que impreſſiones efficere malebam igitur conſcius futurae rationis quam apud chriſtū iudicem initurus ſum uideri quibuſdam gratum aliquid ſubtrahere ob id que male audire apud cinoedos quam libet procaces quam damno cum meo tum aliorum inexpiabili facem ſaeuienti cupidini laſciua uerboſitate ſubminiſtrare viculos quoſdam pariter que rinulos et monticulos admodum ignobiles quos extra coſmographorum tabulas uel nu quam reperietis uel per quam raro id tamen cum ſui ſitus deſcriptione ſatis commoda non curarim tantopere ut uellem tempus chartam inaniter decoquere contemptus idem accidit otioſis nominibus quae neque tropū afferant nec quopiam authore fabulam illuſtrent ceterum pro tam inani farragine comparaui lectoribus ſuppellectilem longe commodiorem ex dictionibus quae legendis authoribus ob ſenſus diuerſitatem haud mediocrem difficultatem afferant adieci praeter herbarum ac piſcium cognomen quorum nullus dictionarius ante hunc meminit ni fallor menſuras ac pondera tam ueterum graecorum que latinorum quam etiam hebreorum hanc equidem operam cunctis hominibus qui literis tum ſacris tum prophanis ſtudioſè uerſentur pulchre nauaſſe iudicaueritis quoties memineritis quàm inſigni uecordia ad lectionem iucundiſſimam rei tam uulgaris ignorantia per docti homines caecutire uideantur tandem ne nimis longa praefacione uobis rebus maioribus que grauioribus occupatis potius faſtidium quam benefitium afferam id breuiter uobis impetrare cupio ut meam uoluntatem hac aequi boni que conſulatis cogitetiſ que apud uosipſos id operis iam coeptum ab equite britanno barbariſſimo ſcilicet utpote paternis tantum aedibus educato nec ab anno aetatis duodecimo ab altero quopiam preceptore literis inſtructo ſibi ipſi nimirum duce tam ſcientiis liberalibus quam utraquè philoſophia quod procul abeſt ut oſtentando dicam uel arroganter ſed ut gratiis deo opt max cum tum ab quibus hic meus liber fuerit utilis utrin que redditis alii muſarum uberiori benefitio freti meo quidem exemplo parem aut maiorem operam aggredi pro ſua republica non dubitarent vos ualete memores primo conatus cuiquam ſcribenti uix unquam feliciter cecidiſſe table correction acetabvlvm rede ſaulcer wherin vyneger lyke ſauce put put reſydue reade table meaſures acinicula rede acuncula acus rede addition aedilitas litum rede litium agaranomus rede agoranomus ambroſia rede addition antiſta reade antiſtita apiaſtrum rede herbe whiche hath leaue • lyke blacke horehound greatter tender nat ſo rough ſmelleth lyke cytron ſome take marche appoſitus iette rede ſette archarius rede addition aſsiptor rede aſcriptor aſſec • rede aſſecla biothenatos rede biothanatos biremes rede climactericus commeats rede commeatus conſuerſco rede conſueſco coriarius adde alſo curriar cura carae rede curae cynomia rede cynomyia congius reade table romayne meaſures decuſsis rede addition leucantha rede leucacantha latumae rede latumiae lonem radere rede leonem radere leſbos ageum rede aegeum lingua bula rede lingua bubula litem ſuam facere one rede one lucifigus rede lucifugus malo mauul rede mauule marconiani rede marcomanni maſtiche adde commonlye callyd maſtix mater matrina rede hath mother liuing medimnus rede table meaſures mediocris dlere rede mediocre medius um myddell melamirus rede melanurus membraneus rede parchmyn velum merdo oreur rede ordure metreta metretes rede greke table meaſures mina rede addicion table poyſe money modius rede table meaſure muralis adde end pelitory wal nedum fundere rede funderem nihil cum fidibus graculo nihil cū amacino ſui rede cum amaracino ſui nucamenta thynges bowghes nutte tree pitche tree hangyng lyke frynges nat leaues numeris omnibus abſolutus euery parte perfyte put ly ¶olus atrum perſely rede alyſander ozinum rede ozimum paralleli lon rede ſon patrizo lyke father reade lyke father pectunculus lyttell fyſhe adde therto ſuppoſe cockyll pharmacentice rede pharmaceutice pituita rowme rede rewme puuia rede pluuia pollex rede fynger bredth third parte fynger polus extre rede axe tree pupugi rede pretertence pungo putitius foole rede foole qui reade latine wherfore epicurus happy lyued owne countray metrodorus whiche lyued athene quinarius rede ende whiche money iii pen farthing therabout remuncopae dryuen rede drawen renones rede wherin ancient almaynes salillum rede lyttell ſaltſellar salinum rede ſalteſellar saxatilis piſces ſaxatili rede ſaxatiles scytae scythia putte theym reade scorpiuros putte deſcription herbe rede lyttell herbe callyd alſo scorpioides hauyng ſmall leaues ſede therof like tayles scorpion seſtertius ſeſtertiū rede afterwarde table coyne sextarius rede table meaſures singillatim euery ouche rede eueriche specimen edere ſhewe profe put oute reſidue sprarchus rede ſpirarchus spithama reade table meaſures squilla rede laſte ende ſuppoſe prane sernunt ſe ſomno rede ſternunt struma whiche rede wherin sulcus ſometyme put dyche rede dyche tthyſus put moche afore declared thyrſus trachelum reade tho ſayle ſayle trulla rede treye tucetum reade ende alſo ſauſage ¶vafer flye reade ſlye vlex ti rede hym addition adarca grownyng rede growynge agger •• rede aggerere ¶here endeth correction coat arm blazon ante b sygnifieth ab ab ſame ſygnification goth worde begynneth cōſonāt ab ab goth word doth begyn vowell abatis two wordes made prepoſition ablatiue caſe plurell batus whiche englyſſhe meaſure ſignifieth officer hath orderyng meaſureseſdra clerke markette abaccidentibus officer vnto whome belōgeth write ſuch thingꝭ chance abacti officer depoſed ſuch conſtrayned reſygne authoritie abactores theues ſteale cattell abacus countyng table cupborde abaculus plinie taken accompt abalienatus mā putteth frō abalieno aui put tourne away abana ryuer coūtrey damaſke vnder hyll called libanus hieron abanec gyrdell prieſtes iewes dyd weare abambulo abdias name prophete abdico aui expell put fauour reſygne offyce refuſe ſonne kynſman abdicauit filium refuſed hym ſonne abdicauit ſe magiſtratu hath reſygned offyce dignitie abdico ixi cere denie forſake abdo didi dere hyde abdómen fatte aboute kydneyes alſo vdder teates ſowe full mylke whiche italy hadde delycate meate abdùco xi cere leade awaye leade pull away take abellinae fylberdes abellino citie naples abemo emi ere take putte garment abemito ueſtem put thy coteplau ce abeo iui uel ii ire depurte go away aberceo forbid eam abercet domo forbyddeth hir howſe aberro aui erre wāder moche depart ferre ſonder aberūco aui wede pluck abeſſa name iuge iſrael abfore awaye abgrego aui ſeuer take oute flocke drawe ſheepe abhinc tyme abhorreo ui rêre abhorre hate abhorreſco feare beholde abiecto aui caſte often away abies ietis fyrre tree abietarius carpentar abigeatus tus felony ſtealynge cattell abigēus ſtealer cattell abigo egi gere dryue away thinge euyll noyous alſo driue awaye cattell thefte deceyte abiicio ieci iicere caſt away renoūce deſpiſe abintegro yet ageyne efteſones abinteſtato inteſtate without teſtament abiudico aui recouer take away iudgement abiugo aui vnyoke diſcharge putte aſonder abiungo xi ere feuer ſonder abiurati ſworne brethern confederatis abiuro aui denye othe kepe thinge wrongfully abiudicatum adiudged gyuen iugemēt ablacto aui weaue ablaqueo aui rydde erthe tree vynes cutte awaye vpper rote may beare fruite ablego aui ſende away abligurio iui ire conſume banketting farynge delycately abloco aui ſette let abluo ui ere waſſhe abnego aui denye vtterly abnepos otis ſonne fourthe degree lyneall diſcent abnuo nui ere deny refuſe coū tenance becke becke away abnuto ſignifieth ſame oftētimes aboleo eui uel ui ere put raſe anulle vndo euer aboleſco brynge naught abolla senatours habyte ſowldiours cloke abominor atus ſum nari take ylle lucke haue deteſtation aborigine people whyche fyrſte helde countrey aboute rome lyued abrode hauynge houſes may alſo taken people whoſe beginning knowen abonor abortus ſum aboriri borne afore naturall tyme aborſus vntymely byrthe nygh conception may called aborſion abortus vntymely byrthe nyghe iuſte tyme delyueraunce whereby chylde dieth abortio oni et abortinus byrthe dyſtroyed ſome hurte myſaduenture medycine aborno tiui▪ tire brynge forthe chylde 〈◊〉 perfecte abortrium idem ac iuſsi faciunt doo none otherwiſe commanded sometyme dothe ſignifie superbis perinde ac ſi rex eſſes thou arte proude thou kynge acatia iuyce fruite called ſiliqua maye called alſo englande veriuyſe acadoemia vniuerſitie whiche toke name place nighe athene plato great phyloſopher taught phyloſophye academici ſecte phyloſophers whyche folowed taughte opynyons plato acanthis idis byrde feedeth dere goo approche sommetyme ſygnifyeth gyue eare harken take hede make moche accelero aui make haſte ſpede accendo di dere kendle inflame prouoke gyue boldnes accenſi ſowldiours appoynted aboute great ante ad hym ſelfe ioyned word ſignifieth vado ad oppidum go towne erat ad ripam fluminis ingens arbor ryuers iyde great tree tyme ſignifieth agaynſt ad illum mihi pugna eſt againſt warre sometyme lyne whanne throwen caſt thē mought plucke agayn vnto hurlebattes adigo egi adigere procure ſtyre bynd othe promyſe bryng dryue faſten ioyne adirciales feaſtes pryeſtes made olde tyme adiicio ieci iicere caſte adde putte increaſe adiicere oculum loke conſyder adimo emi ere take away diminiſhe adineo iniui • e put adinſtar lyke adipales feaſtes prieſtes wonte make adipatus ta tum larded baſted adipiſcoi adeptus ſum gette optain ioynid ꝑſon ſignifieth ouertake aditio tionis acceſſe repaire adito taui tare go aditus tus acceſſe commyng entrie adiudico aui adinge adiugo aui yoke ioyne adiungo xi ere ioyne applye adiuro aui denye othe coniure adiuto aui helpe often adiuuo aui helpe adiutorium helpe adiumentum helpe adlimina porter whiche dothe kepe vtter gate ad liquidum clerely euidently playnly admando aui ſende delyuer thynge one bringe admanus hande redy adminiculor aris et adminiculo ayde ſuccour adminiculum ayde ſupportation admiratio wonderynge admiror raris ratus ſum rari admodū moche ſomwhat reſonably admodum admolior iris molitus ſum liri putte adde admoneo nui êre warne exhorte admordeo momordi dêre byte ſoore admoueo ui êre moue put adoleo leui lui êre adultum begynne grow ſacrifice incenſe fume burne ſwete thynges adoleſcentia aege betwene chyldehode mannes age whiche betwene xiiii xxi adoleſcentior aris atus ſum wanton full youthe adoleſcenturio iui ire playe boye adonia feſtiual dayes kept honor adonis derling venꝰ adonis name chylde whiche ſonne cynare kyng cypre whome venus derlynge whiche ſlayn bore poetes fained venus turned purple floure cake fyne wheate whiche vſed ſacrifice adoreum ſede corne adordior iris adorſus ſum riri ſpeake beginne adorior adortus ſum ſette ſodaynly begynne adorior hunc ſette adoro raui honour inclination body fui eſſe er preſente hande adſummam concluſion finally adtempus tyme adueho uexi uehere bring cary aduena ſtraunger aduenio ni uenire come aduentitia bona goodes whiche doo come vnloked aduentitius morbus ſyckenes cometh without defaute ſome menne called vncome aduentitius commethe place chaunce aduentito aui come often aduento aui come nigh plautus muſtellaria aduentores commune reſorters haunters place aduerſarius aduerſarie aduerſitores ſeruantes whiche fetche home maiſters dynar ſupper aduerſor ſatus ſum ſari repugne contrarye refuſe aduerſus contrary agaynſt aduerto ti tere tourne aduiuo uixi uiuere lyue yet adulor atus ſum lari flatter adulatio flatterye adulter adultera man womā auoutrer adulterinae claues counterfaite key adulterinus na nū counterfaite forged adultero raui rare coūterfaite forge adulterium auoutry adultus ta tum full growen adumbro aui make giue ſhadow repreſente expreſſe peynters doo ſhadowe ymages playne table make ſhewe imboced rounde adunco aui beatitas heape good thynges gathered togyther ſelfe ſufficient without lacke perfection accordyng vertue bellaria bankettynge dyſſhes tartes marchepaynes lyke bellarius ia um apte warre bellator thou arte beholden vnto benedico dixi cere prayſe ſaye welle manne benedicus man wel tunged faire ſpokē beneficiarius receyueth benefitte good tourne beneficus beneficiall lyberall bene uertere turne good precor deū ut haec re bene uertat tibi pray god thynge may tourne good maye thy profite bene uolo tibi wolde good beneuolus fauourable beneuolentia fauour good wylle intente well benignus na num canephora mayden whiche bare heed baſket cofer wherin iewels image goddes cangrena ſore called canker cani taken white heares age canica branne gurgeons caniceps beaſte whiche hathe onely face dogge canicula lyttell dogge bytche alſo ſterre wherof canicular dogge day named dy caniculares caniculus whelpe caninus doggiſſhe dogge caninum prandium dinar without wyne canis dogge kynd fyſhe called dogfiſhe play table ſigne heuē wherof two ſterres oone called canis maior canis minor caniſtrum baſkette canities grayneſſe heares canna poete whiche tyme martialis canna cane rede alſo canne pot alſo village countrey galilee cannae narū towne countrey apulia greatte hooſte romayns ſlayne hanniball cannetum place kanes reedes growe cannitie thatched houſes cano cecini nere ſynge playe ſhalme melody cantabri people spayne cantabria countrey spayne cantharia ſtone whiche hath prynte blacke flye called byttell cantharis idis uel cantharida cantharidae greene worme ſhynynge gloſſe golde whiche bredde toppe aſſhes laide mannes body maketh blyſter cantharus pot iugge alſo beaſte whereof founde noo female alſo kynde fyſſhe alſo blacke flye called bytill cantherium maner charyot wagen alſo perche rayle cantherius geldynge alſo traunſome timber canthus yron wherwith extremytie wheeles bounden ſtraake carte canthes organ pipe canticum pleaſant mery ſonge cantilena melody ſonge cantio ſonge cantiuncula lyttell ſonge cantiro aui ſynge often canto aui ſynge charme cantus tus ſonge canus olde man canus na num graye hore canuſtum towne countreye apulia capax acis taketh conteyneth thynge able receiue capedo greatneſſe veſſell lyke thynge contayneth capena towne rome caper gelded gote ſometyme taken bucke gote alſo name olde grammarion capero aui frowne lowre capeſſo ſi ſere take goo aboute take receyue ſommetyme ſygnifyeth brynge inplautus caperus name kynge caphareus mountayne grece capharnaum chiefe citie galſlee capillamentum heare man heed ſomtyme toppes herbes ſeedes growe capillo make heare capillatus um hath heare capillitium heare heed capillotenus iuſte heare capillus heare capillus ueneris herbe callyd mayden heare capio coepi capere take wyllyngely vnwyllyngly sommetyme ſygnifieth delyte mitigate deceyue capti dolis deceyued cautels ſomtyme cō teyne du boni quid turbae aedes noſtrae uix capiunt good lorde company vſieth houſe woll conteyne theym alſo make capri ciuis blynde alſo great louers named capti capis dis cuppe capiſtro halter putte rope corde capiſtrum haltar capitale et capital offence punyſhed deathe capitalis homo man charta paper alſo leafe paper lyke thyng wherin write alſo mayden neuer chylde chartaceus paper chartilago ginis gryſtell chartophylacium coffer lyke thynge wherin paper rolles kept charundas name man gaue lawes atheniens charus well beloued charybdis gulf ſee sicyl wher daungerous ſaylynge reaſone ſtremes flowynge contrarye eche agaynſt wherby ſhippes therin deuourid chaſma gapynge openyng bealye collario oni conferrynge togither collatis ſignis pugnare fyght fielde pyghte collectanea thynges writen gathered many warkes collectitius um gathered collega felowe companyon offyce colliculus bring paſſe si amas cōfice thou loueſt bryng paſſe alſo gather money permagnam dice ex illa pecuniā confici poſſe thou wylt ſay greate ſomme money mought made thynge conficere breakeplinius nucem inimicitias odium ſtire procure enuy hoſtilitie hate conflauit aes alienum runne dette alſo conflare gather conflauit ex omnibus populum thoſe gathered great multitude alſo make et cur uae rigidum • aui conſpire conſente alſo blowe togyther conſpiratio ni conſpiracye conſtantinopolis conſtantinople cytie thrace conſternium place men whanne bayned layde garmentes conſterno aui ſternere throwe downe ouerthrowe conſternati men ouerthrowen ſometyme abaſhed conſternatio tionis abaſhement conſterno ſtraui ſternere ſtraw paue conſtituo ſtirui ſtituere ordeyne gouerne prouyde couenant fourme thynge conſtat animo ſtedfaſte mynde conſtat pedibus ſure feete hoole • iſ • ania conſtat coſteth ſolde conſtare ſtande togyther manyfeſte knowen agree conſtan • ti conſtant ſtedfaſte conſtanter conſtantly conſtantia conſtance ſtedfaſtenes conſtruo ſtruxi ſtruere buylde ordayne conſueſco ſueui ſueſcere wonteterentiu • ſomtyme vſe carnallye cum eius conſueuit matre clanculum hadde company mother priuelye alſo vſe cuſtome ſometyme lyuecolumel • nec magi humo quam ſtagno conſueuerunt lyue welle lande water conſuetudo dinis cuſtome vſage alſo carnall company conſuêfacio accuſtome conſul li chiefe officer among romaynes conſularis hadde ben conſulle mete conſull conſulatus tus offyce conſull conſulo lui ſulere datyue caſe gyue counſayle accuſatiue caſe aſke counſaylle alſo datiue caſe ſygnifieth prouyde helpe grauiter de ſe conſulere doo ſomme hurte hym ſelfe conſulto taui tare gyue aſke counſayle often delyberate ſhewe myne aduyſe often conſulto delyberately aduyſedly conſultor toris gyueth counſayle ſomtyme aſketh counſayle conſultus ta tum wyſe man conſultus tus conſultum thing conſulted sometyme acte counſaylle conſummo aui ſumme vp recknynge fyniſhe performe make vp make perfite conſummatus ta tum perfyte pointe conſumo ſumpſi ſumere conſume diſtroye conſuo ui ere ſowe togyther ioyne conſyderate conſyderation conſyderatus dothe thinge conſyderation conſydero aui conſyder contabulari bourde laye bourdes roufe floure contagium contagio contagionis contages infectiue ſyckeneſſe contamino taminaui taminare vyolate defyle myxtynge thynges togyther diſhoneſte contemno contempſi contemnere diſpyſe contempne whyche laſſe deſpyſynge contemptus tus deſpyte contemplatio oni beholdynge ſpecially mynde deuocion god contemplo aui contemplor aris beholde intentifely great affection contemporanei one time contemptibilis bile deſpiſed regarded contemptor aris ſette lyttell contendo di dere contende reſyſte ſtryue caſte ſhote darte arow contynue make haſte inforce contentio oni reſyſtence ſtryfe debate alſo ſharpe oration apt confirme repreue continuance inforcement ſettynge forth vehemence contentus ta tum whiche contayned alſo content ſatisfied contineo nui ere contayn withhold lette conterraneus countrey man conteſtari aſke togither wytneſſe conticeo ticui ceére hold peace conticeſco idem conticimum bedde tyme fyrſt part nyght whan men continence vertue refuſing thinges pleaſaunt alſo reſiſtence ylle contineo nui ere refrain kepe back contayne kepe togither contingo tigi tingere touche contigit hath hapned continuo aui contynue mortale man thyng lyuely reſonable mortalle defioculus lacketh ſight one eie defit lacketh deficio defeci deficere lack vnſufficientcicero alſo forſake fayle prudē tia nun quam deficit oratorem prudence neuer fayleth oratourecaeſar quem ſanguis uires que deficiunt bloode ſtrength faylleth alſo forſake capitayne go aduerſary ab eo defecerat went ennemye deflacco aui weare deflagro aui bourne excedyngly deflecto xi tere bowe downe defloreo defloreſco ere fade fal away flowres doo leſe beaultie ſometyme ſignifieth burgen floure defluo xi ere flowe downeward fall away come nothynge deflulis um whiche floweth falleth away thynge defluuiū defluxus fallyng heare defodio di dere burye hyde thinge grounde dygge downe erthe defoetus ta tum deſtytute deformis foule deformed deformo aui fauoreth cōmon welth people hath auctoritie democritus name philoſopher demodocꝰ name harper ī homer demolior iris throwe downe thing buylded demonſtro aui ſhewe openly demonſtratiuus uum ſheweth ſhewed mete ſhewed demonſtratio oni ſhewynge demonſtratiuum genus fourme ſpeakynge wherin oratours didde either commende diſpraiſe man openly demophon ſonne theſeus phedra kynge athene demorior eris dye vtterly demoror aris tary longe kepe back cauſe tarye demonſthenes name famous orator demulceo cere ſtryke gentilly ſoftly hande chyldren houndes whan make moche demum laſte ſometyme ſignifieth onely alway demuſſata contumelia diſpleaſure done diſſimulation denarius certayn coyne diuerſities countreys dyuers weight taken nowe peny denarius um whiche contayneth numbre tenne denarro aui tell order denaſo cutte pull noſe denato aui ſwymme downe denego aui gyue denye gyue denigro aui make blacke deni tenne togither caeſar lib 5 vxores habent deni duodeni que inter ſe commune haue wyues tenne twelue men togither commune amonge deni que concluſyon denomino aui name denoto aui blame den dentis toothe denſo aui thycken make thycke denſus um thycke harde cloſed togyther compacte denſitas tati denſitudo dinis thicknes dentale ſhare plough dentatim order lyke tethe denticulus dentatus ta tum dētoſus ſa ſum toothed denticulare thruſte teethe dentifricium medycyne wherewith tethe rubbed make white dentiloquus ſpeaketh betwene tethe lyſpeth dentio ire putte forthe tethe breede teethe dentiſcalpium inſtrumente wherwith teethe ſcraped dentitio oni puttyng forth growinge tethe denubo pſi bere mary wedde denudo aui diſpoile make naked denuncio aui ſhewe tell thinge man denounce alſo denunciare teſtimonium brynge wytneſſe courte iugement doo chauncerie wytneſſes compelled come denuò agayne deorſum downewarde depalmo aui buffette depango xi gere plant ſette depeciſcor ciſceris couenant promiſe agree patiſe depectus um couenanted patiſed depectus eſt cum hoſtibus patiſed ennemies depecto xui uel xi tere keme diligently depexus um kempte trymmed depeculor aris ari robbe commune weale prince place halowed depelli portenta whā monſtruous ſtrāge thinges happen betokenynge ſome yll auēture happen repele prayer auowes goood dedes depello pul pellere putte downe putte away remoue depulſus putte downe dependeo ere hange downe thing depende dependo di dere paye dependere penas punyſſhed ſuffre peynes deperdo ere loſe depereo ii ire peryſſhe dye loue inordynately depeſco ſcui ere dryue cattell depeſſus rente torne depilis without heare depilo aui pull heare deplano make playne deplanto ſette depleo pleui plere fylle deploro aui lament bewayle deploratus ta tum without hope recouery remedy depono poſui nere laye downe depriue take away leaue thynge man cuſtody depoſitus ta tum layde downe lefte man kepynge alſo deſperate depopulor ari diſtroye waſte countreye deporto aui cary brynge awaye banyſhe deportatus banyſſhed depoſco popoſci depoſcere deſyre moche requyre depoſitorius leaueth thyng man depoſitum whyche lefte nother mannes kepynge layde pledge depraedor ari robbe countrey toune deprauo aui make ylle depraue deprecor cari beſeche deprecari ueniā aſke forgyuenes alſo deprecari refuſe deſyre contrary put awaye denye whiche wolde haue haue deteſtation reſyſte delyuer man prayer deprehendo di ere take man vnwares deprehenſus eſt ſermone taken wordes deprehenſus eſt ſcelere taken faulte alſo deprehendere knowe perceyue deprimo kepe thruſt depromo drawe declare depſo pſi pſere warke thynge handes intent make ſoft depuber depuberis chyld yonge beaſt whiche come ripe yeres depudet hath layde aſyde ſhame depudico caui diſhoneſte vyolate womanne depugno aui fyght valyantly depurgo aui clenſe thing vnder fote depuno make cleane pure deputo aui cutte eſteme iudge repute depuuio ere beate de ••• name people aſia de • ce well moſte colde ſommer dereli • quo dereliqui derelinquere forſake vtterly derepentè ſodaynly derideo riſi dere deſidioſus man ful idelnes ſlouthfull deſigno aui aſſigne note ſigninifie thinge newely deſignator toris marſhall ſetteth appointeth euery man place conuenient degree office deſignatus aſſigned ordeyned deſilio lui ere leape lyght downe deſino ſii nere leaue ceaſſe deſinere artem leaue crafte deſipio pui ere foliſhly wax foliſh deſiſto deſuti deſiſtere leaue deſolo aui make deſolate fro lowſe vnbynde ſette downe mancecilius deſtituit omnes ſeruos ad menſam ante ſe dyd ſette downe ſeruantes table hym deſtringo xi ere bynde harde cutte deſtructile whiche ſhall deſtroyed deſtruo xi ere diſtroy throwe whiche buylded deſubulo aui perce proprely awle bodkyn deſudaſco ſweate deſudo aui ſweatte moch labour deſueſco ueui ſcere diſcuſſe brynge cuſtome deſuerudo dinis diſuſe deſultor toris vaunte horſe leape frome one horſbacke vnto alſo thoſe men warre time battaylle wolde leape downe horſes quyckely fyghte foote leape vppe agayne quyckely deſultores deſultorii equi horſes whiche xi cere diſcerne eſpye conſyder diſpicientia circumſpection aduyſement diligent conſyderation diſplodo ſi dere ſprede diſpondaeus fote meter hath four ſyllables longe oratores diſpono ſui ere diſpoſe order dſpungo xi gere take accompt examyne maner thinge writen diſpunctio examination diſputo taui tare diſpute make plain vnderſtande diſquiro ſiui rere inſerche diligently inquyre diſquiſitio euery abrode diſpatche alſo bringe vnto noughte diſsitus ta tum ſette farre diſtant diſſoluo ui uere loſe vnbynd ſpede paye ſeuerall dettes diſſolui paide diſcharged diſſoluere religionem agaynſt relygion breake relygion diſſonus na num whyche dothe accorde diſſulto taui tare leape hither thither diſto aui differre diſtant diſtantia diſtaunce diſtendo di dere ſtratche retche fyll bottell fylled tranſlation taken ſell alſo fyniſſhe conclude matter variaunce controuerſias diſtrahere ende controuerſies ſuites diſtribuo ui ere dyſtrybute gyue ſondry partes dyuers perſones diſtringo xi gere bynd faſt ſtrain harde rubbe clenſe fylthe ſoyle body thretten ſtryke drawe ſwerde gladium diſtrinxit drewe ſworde sommetyme gathercolumel sereno caelo manibus diſtringi oliuam opertet fayre cleere daye effecte thou doo ſhall ſeeme myne honeſtie accordynge truſt putte profyte ex dignitate tua et ex repub facis thou doeſt accordynge thyne auctoritie weale thy countrey exactio pyllynge people exactor exanguis exangue without bloode tymorous fearefull exanimalis without ſowle lyfe ex animo eſt nature requyreth ex animo facio good wyll mynde gyueth ex animi ſententia accordynge myn appetyte wolde deſyre ex animo illi faueo fauour hym harte ex animo aui kyllplaut ſomtyme make aferde prius quam intus redii exauimatus fui euer came agayn made aferdeq cut • iꝰ multos exanimauii rigor inſolitus niuis vnaccuſtomed chyllyng ſnowe depriued many lyues exanimus mum exanimis exanime deed put feare exanimatus ta tum made aferde troubled mynde ſomtime ſignifyeth deed exanio aui put cleane awaycolum ſagittarum taken ſheffe arrowes faſces roddes bounden togyther axe myddell whiche borne chiefe offycers rome declarynge authoritie whereof ſome ſyxe ſome mo faſellus boote faſti dy certayne day wherin offycer rome called praetor mowghte ſpeake onely theſe three wordes dico addico maye nowe vſed holy dayes faſti certayne bokes wherin conteyned certayne ceremony cauſes ſondrye thynges amonge romaynes concerninge feaſtes ſolemnities whyche longe kepte knowlege common people vntyll laſte deuulgate one caius flauius faſtidio iui ire contemne diſdayne abhorre haue abomination faſtidioſus um full diſdayne faſtiditus ta tum hatred abhorred abhomyned faſtidium hated proprely one abhorreth ſight preſence thing faſtigio aui make rayſe vp heyght faſtigium altitude top height thynge sometyme frixorium fryenge panne frondarius ia ium leaues frondatio ſlyppynge leaues alſo brouſynge frondator oris brouſer wodlopper frondeo frondeſco deſcere beare haue leaues frondeus ea eum leaues frondo daui brynge forth leaues frondoſus um full leaues frons ti foreheed frunt alſo ſignifieth ſhamefaſtnes alſo countenance • raſmꝰ chiliad frontem ferire ſpoken man ſygnyfyeth one diſdayneth extremely fructificus fructuoſus fruitefull fructuarius taketh frute profite thynge pernour profytes fructuarius ria rium whiche beareth fruite doth pertayne fruite fructus tus ti fruite alſo al profite reuenues cometh grounde fruges aut frux frugis increaſe thoſe thynges whiche erth bryngeth forth moſte proprely grayne corne ſometyme ſignifieth rent reuenues frugi moderate profitable neceſſary frugi homo good man thryfty man honeſt man temperate expenſes frugalitas tati moderation liuing ſpeciallye apparaylle dyete ſobre rule alſo ſuffyciencye frugalior frugaliſsimus temperate moſte temperate fruiſcor ſci vſe lybertie frumen vppermoſt part throte gargyll frumentaceus corne frumentarius ia ium pertayning corne frumentario takynge corne frumentator toris taker pourueyour corne frumentor aris gather puruey corne frumentum corne hath berdes eyles moſte vſed wheate rye frunitus wyſe vſynge thynge fruor fretus ſum frui vſe dilectation profyte fruſtatim piecis gobettes fruſtillatim piece meale wounded haylle grandebalae heares arme hole grandis grande auncient great grandiuſculus la lum ſomwhat great good age well ſtryken yeres granditas tati aboundaunce yeres auncientie grandeuus olde corne kepte graphis phidis arte portraiture graphium penſyll wherwith menne doo write table graphicus ca cum kunnyngly perfectly wrought graphicus homo propre man graphice proprely well kunnyngly graphiarium caſe wherin penſiles kepte may called pennar graſſator highe wayes lyeth awayt robbe ſlee men extorcioner graſſor aris ari robbe ſlee men paſſynge hyghe wayes alſo goo come one violent rage therfore ſodayn violent peſtilence ſaid morbus graſſatur ſycknes kylleth mē ſodaynely gratia grace ſomtyme ſignifieth thanke ſometyme benefyte ſometyme rewarde▪ alſo peace loue ſometyme cauſe reſpect alſo prayſe gratus ta tum thankfull pleaſant acceptable gratioſus thankfull alſo fauour people well eſtemed gratis aduerbe betokenynge withoute rewarde ſometyme without deſerte gratuitus ta tum without rewarde vnhyred gratuitó aduerbe ſygnifienge good wyll without benefite grate thankes gratificor ari gratifie doo thynge thankfull conferre benefite doo good tourne grator ari giue thankes god offrynges alſo reioyce good fortune gratulor ari datiue caſe ioyous hym ſelfe good thynge hath hapnedliuius tibi de hac tua fcelicitate gratulor ioyous gladde thou arte proſperitie thou arte sometyme ſygnifyeth gyue thankes vnto god accuſatiue caſe ſignifieth take thankfully acte grauis graue heuy greuouſe ſommetyme ſubſtancial graue hauyng grauitie contrary lyghtnes wantonnes alſo great puiſſant ſometime olde aged ſomtime ſure conſtent ſommetyme plentuous full terra grauts lande laded corne grauiter et graue greuouſely heuily ſubſtancially moche wiſely ſadly grauatus greued grauedo dinis heuyneſſe griefe diſeaſe somtyme mutre reume heed grauedinoſus hath heuye heed grauedinoſus um whiche maketh heuy heed graueolentia ſtenche ſtynke grauo aui greue burden lade grauor ari grieued take grieuouſelye grauate grauatim greuouſly diſpleſantly paynfully graueſco ſcere laded grauida mulier woman great child grauido gette woman chyld grauaſtellus aged grex gregis flocke well menne cattelle gregarius mile ſouldiour taken aduenture choſen gregarius paſtor chiefe ſhepard whiche hath charge hole flocke gregarius canis curre dogge gregalis le cattell whiche flocke gregatim ſondry flockes gremtale apron greſſus ſteppe goinge greſsibile apte goo greſſutus ta tum idem groſſus um greatte groſsi greene fygges groſſuli yonge fygges groſsipion ſeu groſſapinus tree wherof commeth glottony guloſus glutton guliocae grene ſhale walle nutte gummi gūme whiche droppeth frō tree gummatus ta tum dreſſed gumme raſed gummarae arbores tree bryngethe forthe gumme gumminum oyle made aſtronomers call aſcendent horoſcopus pa um euery thynge wherein howres marked horrearius keper barne horreo rui ere whan man thynketh heare doth ryſe alſo quake cold feare ſomtime feare moche horreſco ſcere whan man feleth within hym great colde tremblynge begyn feuer greatte feare somme tyme quake horreum barne wherin corne layde sometyme ſtore houſe wherin thynge kepte horribilis le defaute imputatus ta tum vncutte neuer cutte imu mum loweſt moſt lowe ¶i ante n ſygnifieth alſo rempub toward publyke weale meam partem part particidam agaynſt murderer nauem ingreditur went ſhyp alſo incallidus ſymple without crafte ſubtyltie incandeſco duo deſcere verye hotte angrye incanto taui tare charme incantatio incantamentum charme incapiſtro aui ſtrare halter bynde halter incaſſum vayne incautus vnware incedo ceſsi cedere go walke goo ſtately enter incendo di dere inflame ſette fyre thynge incentio oni ſowning inſtrumentes incepto aui begynne often incerniculum rayinge ſyue wherin corne clenſed ground alſo ſarcer incerno ni nere ſyfte incerto taui tare make doubtefulle vncertayne incertus ta tum vncertayne doubtfull inceſso ſsi ſiere make angry diſpleſure one accuſe inceſto aui pollute inceſtuoſus dothe often pollute inceſtus ta tum polluted inceſtus tus lechery cōmitted one whiche nygh kynne aliance commytteth itseruius alſo ſygnifyeth maner pollucion inchoo begyn alſo performe incido di ere cutte graue liuiu • inciſa loſte spe inciſa prius quam praedicta dy adeſſet hope beinge loſt er euer ſayd day commen incido di ere happen fall ſodaynely come chaunce incile vnaduyſedly incoxo aui ſytte woman taylours done without ſtoole increatus neuer created incredibilis le incredible beleued meruaylous incrementum increaſe increpito aui blame rebuke oftē increpo pui agaynſte man intent indamage hym infibulo aui claſpe gyther inficias ire doubte denye inficiator oris denyeth infici feci ficere dye clothe ſtayne • infecte inficior aris ari denie diſafferme infidus da dum vnfaythefulle infimates baſe people infimo aui brynge lowe infimus um loweſt moſte baſe infirmo aui make weake infirmus •• um vnſtable ſycke feble infirmitas tati vnſtablenes weakeneſſe ingenu • freely frankely ingero geſsi gerere bryng myxt ingitas ratis pouertie inglorius tia um renome fame ingluuies gluttonie alſo cray gorge byrdes ingrandeſco ſci ſcere waxe greate ingratis inſtantia diligence inſtar lyke inſtatio inſtant tyme inſtauro aui new make begin thīg ſomtime renue reform reedify inſtat nigh com hand caeſar ubi ſe diutius duci intellexit et diē inſtare qua die frumentum militibus metiri oportebat whā ceſar ꝑceiued delayed day nigh come whan muſte nedes delyuer corne men warre inſterno ſtraui ſternere couer ſprede inſtrata trapper horſes inſtratū coūterpoynt alſo ſignifieth tapiſry ſerueth couer thing inſtigo inxi gere meue inwardely inſtinctus inwardly meued inſtigo aui ſtere pricke forwarde inſtita purfyll inſtito aui repugne withſtande inſtitor oris chapman mercer alſo ſelleth apparayle fyne ſtuffe goinge therwith inſtitorius ia ium pertaynyng chapman inſtituo tui tuere inſtitute begynne inſtructe teache ordayne inſtitutiones inſtructions doctrine inſtitura ancient maners cuſtoms alſo ordināces pro meo inſtituto purpoſe inſto inſtiri inſtare require inſtantely ſolicite ſtycke reſiſte perſiſt preaſe come immediatly folowe inſtat nowe inſtratum trappier apparayle horſe horſeclothe inſtrumentum inſtrument toole alſo ordinance warre veſſell neceſſaries houſehold huſbandry ſometyme ſignifieth dede charter cōcernyng lande dettes couenantes inſtruo xi ſtruere ſette order aray inſtructe fournyſhe prepare inſubres lumbardes proprely menne duchy melayne inſucco aui ſoke lycour inſueſco ſueui ſcere wonte inſuetus ta tum vſed inſula ile inuirōned water alſo hous town hauīg none hous ioyned ſtretes euery ſyde inſularis belongyng yle inſularius um mooſte vyle proprely men banyſhed iles dygge mettall inſulatus ta tum made yle inſulto taui tare leape vppe ſcorne ſpeake reproche man inſultura leapynge vp thyng inſum ineſſe ſome thynge ſumma vniuerſally alway fynally auguſtinꝰ inſummo fynyſhe inſumo pſi ere ſpende lay money inſuper furthermore moreouer inſuſurro aui whiſper one care integer gra grum yf ſpoken age ſignifieth yong luſty ſpokē mā ſignifieth honeſt al poyntes qualites thynge ſygnyfyeth entier hoole integer aeui luſtye age integraſco ſci ſcere renewed integro aui begyn agayn renewe integrum mihi eſt power pleaſure myne arbiterment intellectus vnderſtandynge intellectualis vnderſtandynge intelligibile maye vnderſtande intelligo lexi ligere vnderſtande intelligentia perceyuyng minde intemerara perfecte ſacryfyces thynges obſerued intemperiae goddeſſes hauynge power doo harme intemperies intēperātia vntemperatnes intempeſta nox mydnyght whan thing ſylence intempeſtas taris caulme watersaluſtiꝰ iugurth whan tempeſte intempeſtiuus ua um thinge tyme ſeaſon intempeſtiue vntymely intendo di dere bende ſtretche alſo loke diligently thynge knytte tie inforce myght intendere animū ſet fixe mynde tenebris ſaltare ſignifieth thynge vnaduiſedly without iugement intentatus aſſayed intentio ſignifyeth intente purpoſe act apointed executid intento aui menace intentus ta tum ſette fyxed inter betwene amonge inter ſacrum et ſaxum poynte peryſhe vtterly loſte interamna citie italye interaneus um whiche within interanea inwardes man beaſt interareſco ſci ſcere dried vp interbibo bi bere drynke intercalaris inter calarius um put ſet betwene intercalaris dy daye leape yere intercalo aui ſet put betwene intercalaris menſis moneth whiche certayne dayes ſette lacked make yere complete whych moneth februarye intercalaris uerſus ſyngular verſe often repeted amonge verſes doo call englyſhe balades ſonges foote refrette ditie intercapedo dinis ſpace pawſe intercedo ceſsi cedere make interceſſiō alſo go betwene betwene intercedit mihi tecum amicitia amite betwene tribuni interceſſerunt tribune dyd let prohibite interceſsio tribunorum let prohibition tribune agaynſt auctoritie offycers intercido cidi cut aſōder ye middisvide cale pinum interciſa porrecta cut made longer intercido cidi ere decaye periſſhe betwene intercino nere ſynge betwene myddell thynge intercipio caepi ere preuent apprehēd one vnware take middes meane ſometyme take interciſi dy dayes diuided part holy day parte warkedaye intercludo ſi ere ſhut ſtoppe let intercolumnium ſpace betwene pilars intercus cutis diſeaſe betwene ſkinne fleſhe whan adiectiue ſignifieth inwarde intercutibus uitiis madentes ouerwette inwarde vice intercutaneus ea eū within ſkin interdico xi cere prohibite greuouſely alſo reſyſte lette interdictum prohibition interdiu day tyme interdum ſometyme interea meane alſo neuer leſſe interea locus meane ſpace intereo ru ire dye vtterly interitus deathe interequito aui ryde betwene intereſt mea tua ſua noſtra ueſtra behoueth v ꝑtaineth hym c alſo maketh matter diuerſitie nihil intereſt tui matter si nihil intereſt regis peto ut dum dico uinculis liberer noo matter kyng pray while ſpeake lette without gyues sometime ſignifieth myddes inter • oemineū woman priuy tokē wherby ſhe knowen man interfici feci ſlee interfluo xi ere flowe betwene intertundo fudi fundere poure betwene intergerimus wall added olde foundation walle ſuſtayne interthae • meane tyme interi within interiaceo cui cere put betwene caſt betwene interibi myddell place interſectum tempus meane tyme interiicio ieci ticere laye put betwene interi mean ſpace time mean reaſon alſo ſometime ſodainly otherwhile interimo emi imere kylle interior interius inner interiungo ere tarie interlino inere enterline interloquor eris qui ſpeke mās tale interluceo lucere ſhyne betwene myddes interluco care make glade myddell wodde interluniū ſpace tyme whiche neither old mone doth appere newe moone ſeene interluo ere flowe betwene waſſhe betwene meales actes ci de os intermedius um myddell intermeſtris luna newe mone chaunge intermeſtrum tyme whan moone poynt chaunge intermico ſhyne myddes interminor aris ari threten ſore intermitto tere leaue put time intermorior dye vtterly intermortuus um deed ſeaſon interneco ſlee one internectiuum bellū warre vtter diſtruction dethe internecio vniuerſall ſlaughter internicinū bellum warre vtterance internodium ioynt man fynger alſo ioynt ſtrawe rede internoſco noſcere knowe thynge amonge thynges internuncius meſſager meane betwene two perſons variance internus nū whiche within inward inter opus euen doinge interordiniū ſpace betwene order interordo dinis idem interpello interrupt lette one ſpeaketh dothe thynge alſo require aſke demaunde interpenſiua certayne piece tymber whiche ſette frome corner walle endes rafter conuaye rayne water ſpoutes interpenſiui paries walles riſe vppon walle haue fundacion grounde interpola newe inuentions deuyſes interpolo putte ſette betwene renewe refreſhe thynge interpolator oris interpolatrix tricis ſhe refreſheth olde thynges make ſeme newe interpolis le interpolus la um renewed refreſhed interpono ſui nere put betwene interponere fidem publicā saluſt • ▪ iugurth promiſe vpon credence conſent people interpremo ſtoppe cloſe interpres pretis interpretour tranſlatour alſo ſtyckler betwene two whiche varyaunce interpretamentum interpretatio interpretation tranſlation interpretor aris ari interprete expoune tranſlate interputo cutte betwene interraſile whiche playne betwyxte two partes grauen imboſed interrex regis ruleth meane tyme betwene ceſſynge auctoritie one principall gouernour deth otherwiſe vntylle elected ſame offyce interregnum ſaide meane tyme gouernaunce rule interrogo demaunde queſtion saluſtiꝰ 〈◊〉 catalinar cic prae 〈◊〉 urb • interrogati legibus tried examinatiō offēded againſt lawis interrūpo rupi pere breke middes interſcalmia ſpaces betwene oores bore galey interſcapilium ſpace betwene ſhulders vnder necke interſcindo di ſcindere cut middis interſepio ſepſi pire diuide middel ſome incloſure interſepta griſtell maketh particion betwene noſethrilles interſero ſeui ſerere ſowe ſet betwene myddes interſono make noyſe middes betwene interſpiro ſpring vp middes interſterno ſtrawe betwene throwe thynges betwene interſtitium diſtance ſpace betwene interſum intereſſe preſent alſo differ diuers stulto intelligēs quid intereſt diuerſitie betwene fole wiſe man intertextus ū wouē wrought betwene • inſelde cloth tinſyl bawdekyn intertrigo ginis gallynge whiche hapneth occaſion ſweate betwene legges toe fyngers intertrimentum intertritura loſſe bothe partes bothe ſydes interturbo trouble excedyngly interuaco vacant void betwene interuallum ſpace betwene interuello ere plucke vp interuenio ire come meane preſent amonge interuenium ſpace betwene vaines interuerro take away craftily falſly interuiſo ere viſite among thā interula ſhyrte ſmocke inteſtabilis whiche law make teſtamēt ſomtime ſignifieth deteſtable inteſtatus dyeth without makynge teſtament inteſtate alſo dieth makyng none heyre teſtament alſo mā credence whome manne wylle take wytneſſe inteſtina bowelles inwarde parte man thynge lyuynge inteſtinum bellum people warre within owne realme inteſtinum odium hate hart mynde mortall hatrede inteſtinum opus inwarde buyldynge tymber pargette intingo xi gere depe one dothe fynger lycour intorqueo ſi quere thruſt throwing darte lyke thynge alſo tourne wynde intra within intra modum leſſe thanne meane ſhorte meane intra famā le thā opiniō mē haue interius inwarde intimus moſte inwarde moſte ſecrete intrarius idem internus na num whiche within intrico wrappe intrimentum damage eyther gyuer receyuour intrinſecus within intritus brayed morter intrò place intro entre goo introcludo ſi dere ſhutte introduco xi cere brynge leade introeo iui ire goo introgredior eris gredi comme intromitto miſi mittere lette introrſus within introrumpo rupi rumpere breake introſpicio ſpexi ſpicere loke introuoco calle intueor eris eri beholde intus place intuſium ſhyrte ſmocke intutus ta tum vnſure intybum erraticum cicorie white endiuegalenus plinius columel inuado ſi inuade entre app̄hēd inualeſco lui ſcere waxe ſtronge confyrmed ſtablyſhed inualidus da dum feeble weake inualetudo dinis febleneſſe inuectiue orationes oration made ageynſt one reprouyng maners lyuynge inueho uexi uehere carye thinge carye thynge place inuehor eris uehi rebuke one vehemently violent ſoore wordes inuenio ire fynde thing whiche man ſeeketh uerba iurare ſworne princis coū ſaylours ſeruantes ſworne vnto thē alſo feaultie uerſum numbre order inuerto tere tourne tourne vppe ſo downe turne vulgar ſpeche proprely turne euery thyng contrary ryght fourme facion inueſtes yonge child inuetereſco raui ſcere age oute vſe aged olde alſo worne almoſte conſumed inuicem togither one inuicem •• gunt loue one alſo ſignifieth thy parte habes re urbana inuicem ruſticas ſcribe nowe thou hatred inuidioſe enuyouſely inuidioſus enuyous perſone ſometyme whiche enuied inuidus hath enuye inuigilo haue watche thynge lay watche care inuinius neuer drynketh wyne inuiſus ū neuer ſene alſo alſo name planette whiche alwaye beneuolent influence courſe iuramentum othe iuratus ſworne iurgioſus um braulyng full contētion iurgium braulynge ſmall contention iurgo braule chyde iuridicus ca cum iuſcum iuſculum brothe wherein meate hath den ſodden iusiurandum ſolempne othe promyſe made god iuſſa commaundementes iuſſus um commaunded iuſta ſacrifices done deed men may vſed funerall exequies iuſta ſoluere cicer pro roſcio proprely funeralle obſequies performe al thinges thervnto neceſſarie iuſtitia iuſtice rygtuouſneſſe iuſtitium ceſſynge tyme minyſtration lawes place iudiciall iuſtus iuſte rightuous man vpright true meanynge manne taken ofte tymes holy ſcripture vertuouſe mā good man iuſtus ta tum equall meane betwene twoo extremity iuſta magnitudo neither leſſe iuſte quantitie iuuenca yonge onely men alſo beaſtes iuuenculus idem iuueneſco ſcere waxe yonge iuuenilis le yonge iuueniliter yongely iuuenis yonge man iunior oris yonger iuuentus tutis youthe ſometyme multitude yonge men iuuo uas iuui helpe delyte iuxta nighe ioyntly togither euen like accordyngesaluſtiꝰ catalinar nunc uero quo loco re noſtrae ſint iuxta mecum oēs intelligitis nowe howe matter ſtandeth ye knowe well el caſe buſynes ye vnderſtande moche iuxtim nygh ixon greate whyte byrde kynde rauens ¶l ante labasco labaſcere labaſcor ſceris fayle decaye labefacio labefacere breake deſtroye labefacto labrum brymme brynke ryuer fountayne alſo fatte lyke veſſell neceſſarie bayned ſomtyme fatte wyne preſſed may vſed keele vate wherinto ale beere putte labicanum towne italy labici inhabitantes towne labicus name ſonne minos named alſo glaucus labilis bile vnſtable whyche wylle ſoone falle ſlypper labina ſlypperneſſe labo falle downe ſodaynly labor eris lapſus ſum labi ſlyde dye fayle fall downe homo paynefull man laboro rare laboure heuyneſſe griefe labruſca wylde vyne labyrinthus maaſe buildyng made like maaſe hard gette forthe lac lactis mylke lacaena kynde apparayle alſo woman lacedemonia lacedaemon uel lacedaemonia citie parte grece nowe called moraea wherof menelaus kynge lacer lacerus um torne rent lacerna ſhorte cloke whiche menne warre wont weare lacernatus cloked cladde cloke lacero teare piece gyue many woundes lacertus lacerta lyzerde euet alſo parte mannes arme elbowe wreſte hande proprely brawne ſynewes arme lacertoſus hauynge greatte brawnes ſynewes laceſſo ſiui ceſsi ſſere rent goo aboute rent good renoume man alſo prouoke man wrathe diſpleſure wordes writynge acte rayle man prycke man ſome yll language acte lachana kynde herbes lachanopoles ſyller herbes laconiſmus ſhorte fourme ſpeakinge lactarius ia um meate made mylke herbes whiche haue iuyce lyke mylke lactarius rij maketh ſondry meates mylke lacteo ere ſucke mylke lactes place within rybbes man benethe nauyll ſoo tender maye ſuffre wounde ſtroke probus ſayth ſay caules wherin ſmall bowelles lye lacteſco ſcere tourned mylke fylled mylke lacteus um mylke lyke milke alſo whiche nouriſhed mylke lacticinia white meates made mylke lactidiaci ſtryken aboute nauyll lacto fede milk alſo deceiue faire wordes lactuca herbe callyd letuſe lacuna dyche wherin water ſtandeth alſo trenche wherby fieldes drayned englyſhe ſynke lacunar beame tymber alſo ſuche thynge doth yet hange marchauntes houſes ouerthwart halle whereon ſet great numbre candelles lacus cu depe place alway full water whiche deriuied didum wete waſhed lycoure madifico facere make weate mador oris moyſture ſometyme ſweate mados certayne kynde white vynes madulſa dronken maeander ryuer countray phrigia whiche hathe many tournynges wyndynges crooked ſubtyll tournynge wayes meanes deuyſes called meandri alſo name mountayne india maedia citie realme thracia maee kynde great crabbes ſee maemacrerion moneth septembre maenala uel maenalus hygh mountayne archadia maenas adis fyſhe whiche ſuppoſe calle menowe maenades woman whiche dyd alwaye folowe bacchus heare ſcatterid like mad woman running hither thither maenoles one name bacchus maeonia countrey aſia laſſe callyd alſo lidia maeonius um maeonia homere excellent poete named maeonius eyther bicauſe borne coūtrey el father name maeon maeotis greatte mere countrey scithia whiche alway froſen maereo e loke maereo et mereor maero make heuy maeror heuineſſe wepynge maeſtit • et maeſtitudo heuyneſſe maeſto et maeſt • ſico care make heuy magalia villagis magia magike whiche two ſortes one ſecrete knowlege naturall qualyties hydde operation cauſes thynges called magia naturalis naturall magike nother ſuperſtionie deuilliſhe called witche crafte ſorcery lyke deteſtable ca cum ſofte malagma ti mollifienge playſter wherby hard impoſtumes made ſoft ripe malaſſo make ſofte rype alſo exercyſe male ylle vnhappily vncommodyouſely myſcheuouſely malea promontorie hylle lienge ſee laconia daungerous ſhyppes paſſe male audire yll reported haue yll name male cogitare de aliquo haue yll opynion one male accepti yll handled yll intreatedci ver brutus • cice maledicentia god ſende hym yuell lucke therof yll maye brooke male ſuada ſhe giueth ſhrewed coūcel malenolentia malyce yll wylle maleuolus malyciouſe malicorium rynde pome granade maligné enuiouſly diſdainfully beinge aduerbeterent phor • ſygnifieth myſchiefe like thyng quid uo • malum ergo ſic ludificamini wherfore myſchiefe thus mocke quid tua malum id referi myſchiefe reckeſt thou therfore haſt thou therwith malus um yll contrary good ſomtime labour vexation ſyckneſſe grefe malice mamertini people campania mamilla lyttell dugge pappe mamma dugge pappe mammare gyue dugge breſte chylde mammeata good ylle parte tempeſtas whiche ſignifieth tempeſt tyme facinus notable dede good ylle ualitudo helth ſyckenes lyke medianus na nū midle mediaſtinus drudge lubber doth howſe maner vyle ſeruice ſwepe clenſe houſe carie wodde kytchen like drudgerybudeus mediaſtimus um myddelmoſte mediaſtrinus ſeruant whiche hath rule hous vnder maiſter medica herbe whiche ſpecially nouryſheth horſes one beinge ſowen efteſones ſpringeth ten yeres continually commonly called sylla medibile ſtate healed curable medicabilis le curable medicamentarius phiſycion medicamentarius um pertaynyng medicyne medicina medicamen medicamētum medicine ſometyme ſygnifieth poyſon medicinalis le medicynable medico medicor aris ari hele cure medicus phiſytion medicus ca cum pertaining phiſike medimnus certayn meaſure corne cō taynynge ſyxe tymes meaſure callyd modius vide modium mediocris dlocre meaſurable meane moderate mediocritas tati meane mediolanum chiefe citie lombardy callyd myllayne medioximus um meane middes medipontus inſtrumente wherwith rope made meditabundus cerefull ſtudiouſe meditariſe exerciſe hym ſelfe meditatè ſtudiouſelyplautus • tich bacch perfectelye fyngers endes meditatio thynkynge dyuyſynge thought alſo exerciſe aſwell minde bodye meditatorius um whyche belongethe medytation mediterraneus myddel lande furtheſt ſee meditor aris ari thynke deepely thynkynge fynde purpoſe lay ſnares ſynge playe ſwetely meditrina goddeſſe phiſyke meditrinalia ceremonyes vſed theym whyche dranke muſte newe wyne meditullium myddell medius um myddes equally diſtant extremytes ſometyme meane medium commune amonge medius meane mediatour betwene ii menne medius fidius othe whiche althoughe ſomtyme nother ſignification yet may nowe commune fourme ſpekynge vſed wiſe faythe body ſens dius iupiter fidius filius nowe vſe meduacus ryuer aboute venyce called nowe brent medulla marowe whiche bone plaut medullo take marowe ſomtime expreſſe vtterly narraiam rem nobis omnem ati que emedulla tell expreſſe vtterly v hole matter medullitus innerly marowe meduſa lady fable report heares minerua tourned adder behelde tourned ſtones perſeus afterward ſlewe ſhe ſomtyme taken one furtes hell melanſilium certayne weapon throwe maegabizi prieſtes diana whiche alway gelded megaera furie turmentour hel whiche paynyms ſuppoſed dyd prouoke •• ere men woodnes megaleſia feſtiual day dedicate cybele called mother goddes among paynyms megalenſes megaleſia playes honour cybele megalium ſwete oyntement megalop • epeia honourable facyon gyuynge imployeng great thynges whych beſemeth man great ſhyppe nauiculor aris ari rowe rowed bote ſalace nauigabilis le ſhyppe maye paſſe nauigable nauigatio iourneye goinge water ſhyppe nauiger pilate ſhyppe whych ruleth ſterne nauigium leadynge ſettynge forth ſhyppe alſo kynde veſſelles ſayle rowe nauigo ſayle rowe ſay caried water ſhippe thynge lyke nauis pomparica ſhyppe whiche ſerueth onely pleaſure hauynge chaumbers bankettynge table greate men accomplyſhe dylygentely gyue applye effect ayde iam mihi videor nauaſſe operam ꝙ huc venerim nowe ſeemeth haue well applyed labour come hyther nauare beneuolentiam conferre declare beneuolence naupegus ſhyppe wrighte naupo • itus ryuer whiche paſſeth slauony nauſea abhorrynge thynges ſeene wherby man prouoked vomyte nauſeoſus um dyſpoſinge vomyte nauſiabundus dyſpoſed vomyte nauſeo care et nauſeor dyſpoſed vomyte ſomtyme vomyte nauſicaa doughter alcinous kyng phaeaces whiche founde vlyſſes whan eſcaped drounynge brought hym father nauſio ere open gape beane doth whan ſpryngeth nauſtilious ſonne neptunus father alcinous nauſtibulum hiue made facion ſhyppe nauta et nauita ſhyppeman nautea currier bleche lycour alſo ſtynkynge water iſſueth pumpe ſhyppe nauticus ſhyppe mayſter nauticus ca cum perteynyng ſhipmen nautulus ſhypman alſo fyſhe ſimilitude lyke ſome ſayled nautilia craft ſhypmen nauus quicke actife naxos yle ſee called aegeum nazarcus man conſecrate dedycate god nazarei men made vowes vntyll certayne tyme nazaret lytle towne galilea nazara citie cappadotia afterwarde called caeſaria ne aduerbe ſignifieng forbeading diſſuading tu ne cede mali giue thou place aduerſitie myſaduentures ſometyme coniunction copulatiue ſignifieth neyther ſomtime rational ſignifieth wherfore ſomtyme cauſal ſignifieth ſomtyme leſte alſo whither ſomtyme interrogatiue ego ne troweſt thou nea ile betwene lemnos helleſpontꝰ necunde place ne plura ne multa ſhortcice 〈◊〉 cluend • • ci • c • nedeth longer tale make ſhort tale ne multis fewe wordes ne multis diogenes emitur wold ſhulde liue graunt thecicero neutiquam wyſe nequaquam necubi place nedum onely ſomtyme yet thynge leaſt eſtimation put laſte nedum ſygnifieth onely fundere pro te ſanguinem nedū pecuniam wolde ſpende money alſo bloode thinge mooſt eſtimation laſt put ſignifieth yet ne crederem tibi obulum nedum vitā meam wyll commytte lyfe vnto thy credēce yet lende one halfepeny nec dum yet neapolis nicticorax racis nyghte crowe ſhryche crowe nictileia ſacrifices night vnto bacchꝰ nyctilopes dothe ſee nothynge nyght lyttell euenynge nictimene daughter nictes lay father afterwarde tourned owle wolde ſeene nyght nymphae goddeſſes water ſpirited beinge conuerſaunt aboute water elfes woman fayrie ſometyme muſes ſo called alſo yonge bee ſone haue receyued fourme nymphea naturall bathe nymphus ſeruyſable man glad pleaſe doeth well duetye officioſus dolor grief procedeth good cauſe raiſon officium office duetye thinge whiche ought done ſometyme taken honour done one may vſed whyche calle homage done ſuche fourme lawe doeth appoynt alſo taken benefyte cic de amicitia officium vſurpare duetye officioſe diligently ſeruiſably offirmo abyde one purpoſe opinion obſtinate offlecto xi tere tourne thinge contrary aboute offoco powre water mouth man beaſt offritiae crafty deceytfull tach offringo ere breake plough lande cared offuciae cawrellis crafty wayes deceyue offula lytell morſell offundo fuſi dere powre aboute make darke blynde ſtayne caſt bringe offuco care put water lycour mannes mouthe ſowke downe vſe lyke men feobleneſſe canne ſelfes take ſuſtenaunce offuſeo make blacke darke ¶o ante g ogdous kynge egypte whyche firſt buylded citie memphis ogdoas adis numbre eyght ogdolapis ryuer commeth oute hilles called alpes runneth rome oggannio ire prate braule ſpeake chydinge oggero • si gerere caſt ſet oculos oggerere caſte ſet eye one oggraſſari goplaut trucu ogyges firſt buylded citie thebe ogygeus um made foūde ogyges ogygea ile betwene phenicea syria ogyris ile syria oleaceus um oyly oleacū colour mixt grene blacke yelowe whyte oleaginus um olyue tree oleagineus idem olearis olearius um pertayninge oyle olearius maker oyle olearus one iles called ciclades oleo eui olui olere ſauour haue ſauour oleoſus um ful oyle oleſco leſcere growe oletum place olyues growe alſo dung ordure man proprely draught iakes oleum oyle olfacio feci facere ſmell olfacto ſmell moche often olfactus tus ſence ſmellyng olibantum meaſure wyne olidus da dum hath great ſauour eyther good badde mooſte communely ſtinkinge oligarchici whiche doo aduaunce ſtate noble men ryche men aboue popular aſtate olim ſometyme well tyme paſſed tyme come nowe late longe tyme paſſed olitor gardynar ſellar herbes rootes olitorius um pertayning pot garden oliua olyue tree oliueta tyme hyll olympia piadis ſpace fyue yeres whereby olde grekes dyd account yeres oure lorde • firſt olympia ſeconde third ſo forth olympicus ca cum olympus olypionices hath victory game olympus olympius um heuenly olympus mountayne hyll grece aboue appereth clowde therfore amonge poetes vſurped heuen olynthus citie thracia olyras ryuer grece place called thermopylas olyfippum citie portugall nowe called vlyſbona englyſh luſſeborn ¶o ante omaſum fat gut chitterling omen mini lucke alſo worde ſentence ſodaynly ſpoken ſome thing hapneth folowe according thervnto aboue expectation herde omentum call golde palaemon oni callid god ſee palaeſtina countrey syrie ioynynge arabie called holy ſcripture philiſt • im palaeſtra wraſ • lyng place alſo exercyſe wraſtlyngeci de os tare primo alſo comelyneſſe palamedes noble greke whyche ſounde certayne letter greeke alſo ſette arraye hooſte fourme watch watche worde palangae leauers porter wherewith left beare tymbre ſuche like thynges greatte weight pecorarius um pertayninge catell pecorinus um rother beaſtis pecten inis wayuers lowme alſo combe alſo place aboute pryuy membres heare doeth growe alſo ſtickes wherwith mā ſtryketh doulcemers whan pedamen pedamentum ſtake forke whereby vyne hoppes lyke thinge ſuſtayned borne vppe pedaneum idem pedaneus um quantitie foote length diſtaunce pedanei iudices inferior iuges went foote pedarij senatours whiche dyd ſhewe opynions wordes onely meuynge ſelfes towardes thoſe perſonnes whiche rayſonned whoſe ſentences dyd approue lyke parliament houſe pedatim one fote goeth foote foote pedatio perſpecto tare loke well aboute perſpicaci • tati quyckeneſſe ſyghte conſyderation perſpicace aduyſedly good conſyderation perſpicaciter idem 〈1 paragraph〉 perſpicientia per • yte knowlege perſpicue cleerely openly perſpicax acis ſeeth quyckely doth thynges conſyderation perſpiceo ſpexi ſpicere ſe vnderſtand playnely perſpicuitas tati clereneſſe proprelye wordes ſentences eaſyneſſe perſpicuus um clere playne eaſye perſpiſſó aduerbe late plautus perſtino ſette pryce thynge perſto ſtiti ſtare abyde fyrmely perſtrepo pui ere make great noyſe perſtrictores tugglers perſtringo perſtringere wrynge harde towche thynge ſhortely ſpeakynge wrytynge dull darke moche lyght perſtringere aures fylle eares noyſe perſtringere nomen aut famam gyue man ylle name horatius perſuadeo perſuaſi perſuadere induce one beleue truſte aduyſe ſtyre vehementely perſuaſibile perſuaſibili • er ſuche wyſe may perſwade perſuaſor oris perſwader inducer thynge perſuaſtrix womanplautus bacch whiche inducethe moueth lamēt buryenge men woman praeficio faeci ficere put auctoritie gyue rule praefectura auctoritie rule praefectus rular praefigo xi gere ſhut afore praefinio niui ire determyne aſſigne appoynte praefinitus ta tum prefixed praefoco care ſtrangle choke praefractus cta etum harde vnflexible whyche wyll rather breke bowe alſo broken praefracté obſtinately praefrigidus da dum colde praefulcio wolde yll cuſtome ſhoulde brought vp praegeſtio ire reioyce moche praegnans ti woman childe praegrandis de greate praegrauatio great griefe praegredior gredi go praegrauo greue moche praehendo di dere takecic p ••• ad atti ti liuius manum praehendere take hande praehenſatio ſolicitinge laboringe attayninge ſome greate office praehenſo imbrace ſet honde one ſolicite praeiacio praeieci praeiacere colum 9 caſt thinge praeiacio cui cere lye praeire iuramentum miniſtre gyue othe praeiuditium thinge one decyded determyned maketh rule example men folowe diſcuſſe ſemblably lyke mater thoſe cal rulyd caſes mater law example iuges praeiudico iuge ſometyme condemne alſo let praeiuro rare ſweare praeiuratio othe taken hym firſt ſweareth praeiurator toris whiche firſte taketh othe fore man iury firſt witneſſe whome men ſweare accordynge othe gyuen vnto praelabor beris bi fall firſt praeliaris pertayninge batayle praeliator toris warriour praelicenter wantonly praelior aris ari fyght batayle cato praeliganeum vinum praeligando ſuppoſe ſo called eyther bycauſe fyrſt runned put veſſelles el bycauſe put ſacke faſt knytte afore praeligo gare bynde afore praelium batayle alſo fyght batayle ſometyme acte generation praelongus um longe praeloquium begynninge communication thinge ſpoken thetorike named exordium praeloquor queris qui ſpeake telle praeluceo cere beare lyght one torche candel alſo gyue light another praelucere alijs virtute ſhyne vertues praeludium proheme muſicians mynſtrelles doo playe begynnynge er come ſonge▪ purpoſe playe praeludo ſi dere playe praelum preſſe praelumbo breake one loynes praeluo luere pourge waſſhe cleane afore praemando daui ſende praemanibus redy hande pla • mo •• e •• praemature ſoone iuſt tyme praemature vita careo dye afore tyme praemeditor taris tari aduyſe man thinge prae ſero prae tuli prae ferre declare deede worde geſture prae te fers iracundiam thou ſhewyſte thy ſelfe angry alſo confeſſe alſo haue thynge remembraunce praemercor caris cari bye aforehande praemeſſum ſacrifyce offrynge cere care corne fyrſte repyd praemetium fyrſtcroppe praemiatores theues ſteale nyght mought ſaye whyche commytte burglary praemiator rewardar praemineo nui ere better another excel aboue another aſtate vertue praemior aris ari gyue rewardes praemioſus ryche money praemiſsio ſendinge afore praemitto miſi tere ſende afore praemium rewarde gyuen hym hath done notable laudable thingcellius praemoderor aris ari playe inſtrument praemodum aboue meaſure praemoleſtia feare thinge comeci tuſ • praemollis le tender delicate praemoneo nui nere forewarne praemonſtrator toris telleth ſheweth thynge happenethterent heau praemonſtro ſhewe praemordeo dere byte rebuke praemorior riris ri dye er tyme come praemunio iui ire prepare praenarro rare tell praenato tare ſwymme afore praeneſté citie italy praeneſtini people citie preneſte italy praeneſtinus um preneſte praenomen firſte name marcus quintus lucius haue name baptyſme praenoſco noui noſcere knowe afore praenoto tare make annotation inſcriptions praenuncio ſhewe afore praenuncius firſt meſſenger fyrſt bryngeth tydinges praeoccupatio fygure rhetorike whan ſaye tell thinge yet therby couertly wil declare matter make ſuſpected praeoccupo pare take poſſede thinge preuencion praeopto tare rather deſire praeordinatio fyrſt ordinaunce praeordinator made fyrſt ordynaunce praeordino ordayne afore praeparcus ca cum ſcarce nygarde praeparo prepare make redy praepedimentum let praepedio diui let moche praependo dere hange afore praepes praepetis ſwyft praepetes aues byrdes ſhewed ſelfes firſt diuinours called augures whereby ſuppoſed knowe ſhulde enſue praepeto tere begynne firſt praepilatus ta tum hedded yron iauelyn dart alſo ſharp afore lyke heed dart thoughe hath none yron▪ horne lopſter wherewith ſwymmeth praepinguis fat praepondero waye worth praepolleo lere excede praepono ſui ponere put ſet praepoſitus ta tum ſet aduaunced aboue ſet autoritie praepoſitus ti autoritie chief office praepotens puiſſant mighty praepoto tare drynke afore brynge good lucke drinkinge praepoſterus ra rum ouerthwart oute ordre saluſtius 〈◊〉 iug praepoſteri homines thing laſt whiche ſhulde haue done firſt praepoſteré fieri done againſt good ordre whan ſeruaunt commaundeth maſter peple rulars foole wyſe man praeproperus ra rum quicke haſty praeputium ſkynne couereth heed man priuey membre praeripio pui pere preuent catche praerideo dere lawghe praeriſor oris laugheth fore one praerodo ſi dere gnawe eate moche praerogata beneficia benefytes afore employed praerogo gare employe gyue afore praerogatiua praerogariuum prerogati • e one preferred afore another praerumpo pere breake aſonder praeruptus ta tum broken ſometyme taken hyll broken ſydes harde go praerupta loca place broken man maye paſſe praeſagio gire praeſagior perceyue knowe thinge happen praeſagus pronoſticatour perceyuer thinges er happe praeſagium praeſagatio amonge auncient writars
