mannes nayles praeſens ti preſent praeſentia praeſentiarum preſent tyme praeſentius better praeſentiſsimus um beſt ſureſt praeſentiſsimum venenum greateſt mooſt feruent poyſon alſo ſtronge preſens animus ſtronge good courage alſo fauorable deum praeſentem haber hath god fauorable vnto hym praeſentaneum remedium ſhort ſodayne remedy praeſentia preſence praeſentio praeſentiſco cere fele perceyue plautus caſina hath autoritie prouince next vnder prince ſometyme ſignifieth defendour alſoo ſure locum praeſidem ſure place praeſideo dere autoritye dignitie alſo haue authoritye rule praeſideratio excellently praeſtare culpam take blame hym praeſtare officium deuoyrecicer • praeſtare iuſiurandum take othe praeſtega place open afore keuered behynde lyke porche men ſyt recreacion buſyneſſe praeſter venymouſe ſerpent whome ſtryken dyeth thurſt praeſtigiator toris iuggler pom feſt praeſies titi auncient wrytars called prelate praeſtigium iugglynge caſte inchauntment deluſyon praeſtino prepare byenge thinge praeſtituo ere determine preſcribe appoynt ſhal done iſtam enim culpam quam vereris ego praeſtabo ci de os blame thou feareſt take vppon praeſto ſtiti ſtate better another thinge wherewith comparyd excell alſo vndertake waraunt ſometyme graunte alſo beneficiall beware exchue feare perfourmeci ad q 〈◊〉 gyue exhibite repreſent ſhewe lende aſſigne appoynt thinge praeſto aduerbe ſomewhat praeſtruo ſtruxi ſtruere ordayne firſte buylde praeſul li prelate praeſulatus tus dignitie prelate praeſulto leape daunſe afore praeſultor praeſultoris leadeth daunſe praeſum fui praeſſe afore aboue dignitye autorytye praeeſſe negotio chief buſyneſſe praeſumere animo coniecte praeſumo ſumpſi ſumere take fyrſte preuente praeſumptio takinge receyuynge alſo called preoccupation whan declare firſt aduerſary ſaye iuges opynyon againſt argue diſſolue reaſon praeſuo ere ſowe afore praeſurgo gere ryſe afore firſt praetego gere hyde couer chiefly praetendo ere laye thing er come alſo cary beare afore alſo ſhew pretende allege ſet thinge aboute incloſure praetendere ſepem make hedge aboute praetento tare tempte aſſaye afore praeteriue ſklenderly praeterduco cere leade afore leade forth praetergredior di paſſe go beyond praeteritus ta tum paſſyd praeteriti deed departed deceſſyd alſo ſuynge office dyd ſuffre repulſe put backe praeter propter cauſe reherced praeter except alſo beſyde ouer aboue praeter oculos eyen againſt contrary praeter morem againſte cuſtome facion praeter ſpem vnloked praeter opinionem otherwyſe thā thought praeter caetera praeter aequum againſt raiſon praeterbito tare go praeterea moreouer beſyde none el mihi credis praeterea nemini thou beleueſt none el alſo ſignifieth afterwarde praetereo iui ire go ouer paſſe leue oute thynge ſhulde ſpoken praetermitto miſi tere leue vntouched forgete leue oute praetermiſsio forgetynge leuinge thynge praeterquàm onely otherwyſe moreouer praeter quam quod praeterueho carye throughe praeteruolo paſſe throughe quickly praetexo ui ere make ordayne firſte couer hyde praetexta longe garment myxte purple ſilke whiche veſture noble mennes ſonnes vntyll came vnto xvii yeres age therfore ſuche child called praetextati alſoo aboute neckes lytell round iewell golde facyoned like hart wherin incloſed ſome thinge great vertue praetexta alſo robe aſtate whiche kynge romaynes chief officer dyd weare whan ſate maieſtie praetexta comaedia enterlude wherin perſonages highe dignitie praetextatus ta tum diſhoneſtsuetonius gellius macro vnclene ſpeche actes feſtus taketh contrary ſence praetextum pretence coloure praetiamitatores officer went prelate called flamen proclayming openly men ſhulde ceaſſe theyr warke bycauſe lefull thoſe prelate beholde man warkynge praetimeo ere ſore aferde praetingo gere touche afore praetondeo ſheere klyppe rounde praetoritius um praetorius praetorium ius lawe made praetor praetor toris chief capitayne warres citie contraye praetor whiche hath autoritye ſit iugemente gyue ſentence cauſis praetorianus attendant praetor praetorium houſe pauylyon hym praetor alſoo prince palayce manoure ſomtyme place iugementes gyuen ſometyme coū ſayle wherevnto praetores aſſembled praetorius hath bene praetor praetorius um belonginge office praetor praetura dignitie miniſtration praetor praeualeo lere preuayle better value praeualidus dum ſtronge myghty ſometyme greate praeuaricario colluſion alſoo one toucheth thing lytely ought inculked playn declaracyon el repeted makynge moche purpoſe praeuaricor aris ari ſwarne truthe go right waye leue vnſayd ſhulde ſpoken touche thinge ſhortely ſpekynge warke colluſion ſuffringe aduerſary optayne hurte another perſon praeuaricator toris leueth ryght waye ſpeketh whych ought ſpoken alſo ſpekinge ſelfe aydeth cauſe aduerſary doeth thinge colluſion praeuelio brynge firſt praelo couer hyde afore praeuello lere pull plucke afore praeuenio nire come preuent ti liuius de bell pu ci de di praeuentio preuention praeuideo dere foreſee beware praeuius leadeth waye praeuerto uertere ſet care forplautus amphi nec vxorem praeuortiſſe dicant prae repub let ſaye ſet wyfe weale publykeplautus milite alſo tourne ſet ſyde ne que praeripio pulpamentum ne que praeuorto pocu lum take awaye thy meate ſet tourne aſyde thy drynke plautus capt praeuertor deponens idem quod praeuerto alſo go afore inde illico praeuertor domum thenſe went home afore alſo tourned furth foreis enim clauſit plautus amph ne praeuorteretur foras hath ſhyr faſt doore leeſt ſhulde turned forth alſo thinge firſte thinge praeuorti hoc certum eſt rebus alijs omnibus surely ſhall done thinge praeuertere ſerio turne erneſtplautus amph si quid dictum eſt perſocum non aequum eſt id te ſerio praeuortier thinge ſpoken iape rayſon baſſhefully pudeo duo dere aſſhamed pudet pudebat puduit puditum eſt aſſhamed pudibundè ſhamefaſlly pudibundus da dum ſhamefaſt pudicè chaſtly honeſtly pudicitia chaſtytye clenneſſe lyuynge syluſtius mulettour keper mule whiche taketh fourthe parte wage gayne quartuſdecimus fouretenthe quartus ta tum fourthe quaſi lyke amas quaſi filium thou loueſt yf thy ſonne alſoo ſaythe thowghe tu obiicis quod uxorem repudiauerim quaſi tu idem non feceris thou imbraydeſt haue forſaken wife laythe thou haſte doone ſoo quaſillum lyttell hamper quaſſabundus ſhaketh moueth headeplautus quaſſo ſhake moche often whyche alſoo ſometyme ſygnifyeth howe efficite qui detur tibi doo ye canne howe whatte meanes thou mayſte haue hyr qui uocâre plautus amph howe arte thou callyd alſoo yt ſygnyfyeth dauo iſtuc dedam negoti te • non poteſt p qui • quia habet aliud magi ex ſeſe wyll commytte th • e mattier dauy may p hath nother greatter mattier doo hym ſelfe alſoo ſygnyfyeth frome whenſe qui iſtaec tibi incidit ſuſpectio ter whens ſuſpycion happened vnto alſo ſygnyfyeth wolde god qui illum di omnes perdiunt terent phorm pray god vengeaunce lyghte hym alſoo yt ſygnyfyethe bycauſeterent▪ prolo nam prologis ſcribundis operam abutitur non qui argumentum narret ſed qui maleuoli uaeteris poetae maledictis • eſpondeat ſpendethe laboure wrytynge prologue bycauſe wyll telle argumente moche wolde make aunſwere yuell reportes olde enuyouſe poete alſoo ſygnyfyeth whereforecice •• qui enim beatior epicurus quod patria uiuebat quam metrodorus quod athenis wherefore epycure moore happye dydde dye countreye metrodorus dyed athene quia alſoo hit ſygnyfyeth thatci de 〈◊〉 ▪ sed tamen recordatione noſtrae amicitiae ſic fruor ut beatae uixiſſe uidear quia cum scipione uixerim take pleaſure remembrynge oure frendeſhyp maye ſeeme haue lyued moſte fortunatelye lyued scypyones companye alſoo ſygnyfyeth mochsaluſtias catil sed quia multis magnis tempeſtatibus vos cognoui fortes fidosque mihi eo animus auſus quia ne dede quias quiatis cuius cuiatis quias um cuius um quibus extremis quorum extremo literae dantur mihi te quibus extremis ſcriptum eſt receyued letter frome laſte ende whyche hit wrytten quicquid eſt ſo euer ſo euer quicquid pauxillum neuer ſo lyttellplautus trucule • qui cum cum quo qui cum loquitur filius whome dothe ſonne talke quicunque ſoo euer quicquam thynge quid quid cauſae pryſoners doo bryng quid id ſit hominis cui lyco nomen ſier plautus praulo terent hea •• man whoſe name maye lyco quid mulleris uxorem habes maner woman haſte thou thy wyfe quid rei eſt mattier igbo intro ut quid huſus ſit rei ſciam terent eunucho wyll goo may knowe mattier is▪ quid rei eſt tibi cum illa haſte thou doo hyr terent phorm plautus picudolo quid ſententiae thyn opinyon quid iſtue uerbi eſt meaneſt thou therby alſo quid taken aliquid ſomewhat alſo ob quid wherfore quid ſenem quoad expectas ueſtrum terent phormi nowe longe wyll ye tary maiſter note dayly forme ſpeakynge quid reherſeddonatus whā paſſe one matter quid mecum eſt tibi haue quid faceret aliud ſhoulde doo el quid eo doo propere curre ad pamphilum p quid eo die orate ut ueniat rūne quyckely pamphilus p say prayed hym come quid uerbis opus eſt plautus nede manye wordes quid multa uerba idem quid multis moror ſhall longe tarie quid mea refert cicero de •• icitia care alſo quid ſignifyeth wherin quid enim indigen affricanus mei wherin scipio nede meterent iunucho quid iſtic si certum eſt facere facia • uerum ne poſt conferas culpam woldeſte thou ſhoulde doo thou determyned doo goo goddis name afterward put fault terent phorm quidnam hit wherfore quidnam ille commotus uenit commeth ſoo chaufed alſo ſygnifieth whatterent eunucho reuiſo quidnam chaerea hic rerum gerar come ſe cherea doth terent heaut quid ni quo ore appellabo parrem tenes quid dicam quidni countenaunce ſhall ſpeake father▪ woteſt thou wyll ſay wherfore ſhuldeſt thou ſo alſo ſignifyeth ye archimedem noſti p quid ni terent eunucho quin dic quid eſt go tell quin etiam alſoo pudet terent heauton credo neque id iniuria quin mihi moleſtum aſſhamed beleue without cauſe alſoo ſorye therfore quin taces terent andria wylte thou holde que penates obſecro obteſtor vitae redde priori wherfore beſeche praye thy good aungelles ſake loue betwene ſainctes thyn auouryes reſtore eftſones fyrſt lyfe ſtate erſtter eu alſo ſignifyeth sane quod tibi vir videatur eſſe hic nebulo magnus eſt thou thynkeſt hym man ſurely ſtourdy vagabunde quod abſ que moleſtia fiat cice sulp ſo diſpleaſure vnto quare pergratum mihi feceris ſi eum amicitiam receperis atque eum quod abſque moleſtia fiat ſi qua opus ei fuerit wherfore ye ſhall ſinguler pleaſure ye take hym fauour ſo diſpleaſure vnto whan neede requyrethe good lorde maſter vnto hym quod confyrmation ratio rayſon counſayle purpoſe care reſpecte cauſe maner waye fourme proportion ratiocinatio rayſonynge ratiocinator oris caſter accompt ratiocinor aris rayſon gather argument accompte rationabilis le rayſonable rationale whiche hath vſe raiſon alſoo whiche preeſt weareth maſſe heed putteth backe lyke hoode rationes referre yelde accompt rationem dare idem plautus amph terent heau ter ad rationem dictare accompte ratio de integro ineunda eſt mihi muſte fynde another meane rationem ſubducere nunquàm ita quiſquam bene ſubducta ratione ad vitā fuit quin re aetas vſus ſemper aliquid apportet noui neuer man ordre lyfe ſo well aduyſed mater age experience bringeth hym ſomwhat ſtraunge ratio conſtat matter appiereth ſhewed rationa • ius boke accompt alſo boke belongynge freſh courſeplautus • tin poſtquàm thermopotaſti gutturem recipe te recurre pede recenti thou haſte warmed thy throte good drynke take thy harte make freſſhe courſe recenter newly freſſhely recentius ca • ere blowe retrayte alſo prouerbe ſignifyeth fynyſh ende contention receſsim aduerbe whyche ſignifyeth goynge backe receſſus u goynge awaye backe plautus men • ch recident te hae contumeliae thoſe rebuke ſhall lyght terent • olo recidit ad paucos come fewe perſonnes recidipna garment ſoupe recidiuus um eftſones reſtored ſomtyme eftſones decayed fallen recido dere fall eftſones fal backwarde recido di dere cut agayne cut behynde recinium ſquare garmente whiche dyd weare dydde caſte one part thereof ouer ſhoulders backe lyke frenche clokes recinia • dydde weare ſuche clokes recino ere ſynge agayne recipere ſe retourne come agayneterent phorm percuncta tum igbo ad portum quoad ſe recipiat frater wyll go ſeeke hauyn vntyll brother come agayne recipere ſe ad coenam come ſouperplautus fauius wyſe captayn • recipere recouer cum quidem audiente salinatori qui amiſſo oppido fugerat arcem glorianti atque dicenti mea opera quint fab yarentum recepiſti certe inquit ridens nam niſi tu amiſiſtes nunquàm recepiſſem hearynge salinator towne tarentum loſt fledde caſtell ſayenge vnto hym thou haſt recouered tarentum q fab meanes true ſayde lawghinge thou haddeſt loſt recouered alſo reſerue man owne vſe recipie cato vſeth recipiam receptus ta tum receyued receptio retourne backeplautus aſinar drawynge bryngynge agayne quid tibi huc receptio ad te eſt meum virum draweſte thou ioyned part longar ſhortar another rectum aduerbe ſignifyenge ſtrayghteterent eunucho cur non rectum introibas wenteſt thou ſtrayght ſtrayght waye recté well ynoughe quid tu igitur lachrymas aut quid e tam triſtis pamp terent hecy recté mater quid fuit tumulti wherefore doeſt thou mourne arte thou ſo heuy pamph well ynoughe mother noyſe rectè parere brynge forth monſter rectè good right good raiſon recté dicis thou ſayeſt truely rectè eſt ynoughe haue ynough tum quod dem ei recté eſt terent heauton haue alſoo ynough gyue hym recté facere alicui good man stultus ſine gratia e tibi rectè facere plautus aulularia quando quod facia perit thou art foole without thanke hym good whan loſt thou doeſt recté ferre take paciently si ſapis ne que praeterquam quas ipſe amor moleſtias habet terent eunucho addas illas quas habet rectè feras thou wyſe adde griefe loue bringeth hym bringeth ſuffre paciently recté ſignifyeth ſometyme nothynge donate ſayth rogo nunquid velit rectè inquit abeo aſked wold thyng nothinge ſayde went way alſo ye ſtraight waye tu ru hinc abis ter ad rectè goeſt thou contray ye ſtrayght waye rectè valet ſhe good helth rectius better rectitas rectitudo iuſtice rightwyſneſſe rector toris rular rectus nominatife caſe rectum inteſtinum gutte frome whenſe ordure paſſeth rectus ta tum ſtraight crooked vpright iuſt recubitus lyenge reſte recubo lye reſt recudo ſolde redhibitio reſtitution redigo degi digere brynge force cunnynge ſometyme reſtore redigere ordinem compelle menne lyue according aſtate profeſſiō redis ad ingenium thou doeſt thyne olde facion thou arte wonte doterent hecy ter redire ad ſe sed paululum ſine ad ut redeam lette take breathe lyttelle tandem reprime iracundiam arque ad reredi nowe leaue thy fume remember thy ſelfe redeam ad pauca vt ad pauca redeam terent phorm ac mittam illius ineptias intente wyll ſhorte paſſe ouer foly redi ad rem goo pourpoſeterent heaut mattier redijt ad reſtim re opera tua ad reſtim mihi quidem re redijt terent phormi thy meanes brought poynte hange ſelfe redijt ad raſtros nam ſi illi pergam ſuppeditare ſumptibus menedeme mihi illaec ueré ad raſtros re redijt surely ſhuld mayntayne expenſes menedemus wolde brynge rake corne graſſe lyuynge redit re eum locum thynge come ſo paſſe eum iam re redijt locum ut ſit neceſſe matter come ſo paſſe remedy redit mihi animus terent hecyra courage rire olde wryters taken gyue thanke reducem reduces cal ſuch whiche brought exile captiuitie reducere brynge ſaulfe méque oppido arcem reduco apulcius conueyed ſelf quyckely caſtell alſoo pacyfye whiche obiected referio rire ſtryke agayne referre ad aliquem aſke one counſayle matter referre de aliqua ad senatum whan conſuls purpoſed matter senate deſyrynge senatours reaſon conſulte therof referre pedem ſet forthe foote gooplautus mercatore eutyche hāc uolo rem prius agi quam meū intro refero pedem wyll thyng eutyche doone go oone foote retulit ad pedem came toward meplautus epidico referunt haec ad rem theſe thinges pertain matter refero acceptum omnia quae uidimus cicero ſi recte rationabimus uni accepta referemus antonio ſee yf recken well may impute onely antonie quod uiuit mihi acceptum refert confeſſeth longe nowe lyuethecicer pro c • uen verum omnem tranquillitatem quietem ſenectutis refert acceptam clementiae tuae tranquyllytie quyeteneſſe age confeſſeth procede haue receyued mercy goodneſſe referre gratiam gyue thankeplautus moſtell nunquam ego illi poſſum gratiam referre ut meritus eſt de canne neuer gyue hym thanke ſuffycyent hathe doone spero ego mihi quoque tempus tale euenturum plautus merca ut tibi gratiam referam parem truſt tyme ſhal come ſhall doo moche pleaſureci sal non enim ſperaſti mutuam tibi gratiam relaturum ut uiciſsim tuos compellarem thou dyddeſt thynke wolde wyſe haue requyted remembrynge thyne auncetours thou haſte doone myne referri acceptum brought reckenyng poſteaquam reus factus eſt primo negabat opus acceptum referri poſſe accuſed fyrſte denyed warke mought brought vnto reckenynge referre melius turne better vſe referre more expreſſe condicyons maners referre oculos caſte loke vpon oneplin epiſt 156 referre par requyte ille quem beneficio adiungas ex animo facit ſtudet par referre thou getteſt benefytte dothe thynges good harte ſtudieth requyte referte pedem uel gradum ſteppe back retreate referre ſhewe tel illa retulit quaeſiuit que quidnam mihi uideretur tolde aſked thought therin cicer pro seruilio refert cuius conſilii magni referebat te inter eſſe atte whiche counſayle hadde bene neceſſarye ye ſhulde haue beneterent phorm parui retulit non ſuſcepiſſe made lyttell matter tooke hir mea quid refert care mea nihil refert haue noughte doo tua refert thy profyte quid refert feciſſe regibus ut mihi obedirent ſi hodie hic umbraticus deriſerit auayleth haue made kynges obeye yf nowe lewde knaue ſhall laughe ſcorne refert expedient neceſſaryever geor neque enim numero comprehendere refert reſtored recouered ſicknes alſo renewed new made refigo fixi figere make faſte ſure thruſte harde sometyme ſignifyeth contrarye drawe whyche faſtned ci phi 13 refigere tabulas leges vndoo deſtroye lawes acta antonij reſcidiſtis leges refixiſtis ye haue cancelled actes antony vndoone diſſolued lawesver aenei fixit leges pretioque refixit ſtablyſhed lawes money efteſoones diſſolued refirmo faſten reflexit neither promyſe othe yet pitie withdrewe pulled backe reflo blowe agayne contrarye refluo xi fluere flowe refluxus u tyde whanne water floweth refocillatio comfortynge refreſhyng recreation refuga vnrulye perſone whiche wylle ordered refugio gere flee run away backecolum 4 alſo refuſe refugium refuge ſuccour place one may ſuccoured refugus um whiche gothe awaysidonius layde aparte refulgeo gêrè ſhyne refundo fudi fundere reſtore whyche lacketh quicquid deerit seneca ex meo refundam whatte ſoo euer dothe lacke wylle make vppe myne owne alſoo paye home agayne yelde id erat non tam accipere beneficium quam refundere ſoo mocheseneca de benefic receyue good tourne doo good tourne alſoo caſte vppe vomyte quod heſterna crapula ingurgitauerat plinius palam refudit whyche regius morbus iaundyſe regno reigne regnum realme gouernance rego xi regere rule gouerne regor geris ruled gouerned regrador de • di goo backe mar regredo dere reuoke call agayne regredior regredi go backe regreſsio regreſſus u returne backe reſorte backe regula rule regularis regulare whyche vnder rule regulo rule dyrecte regulus prynce lorde lyttelle countreye proprely regulus chylderne kynges alſo regulus lyttell byrde callyd wrenne ſerpent callyd cockatryce whiche ſleeth man ſyghte alſoo name conſule whiche kepynge promyſe putte cruelle deathe carthaginenſis alſo great rhetorician tyme plynie reieculae uel reijculae • e ſheepe drawen folde aege ſyckeneſſe kebbers crone cullyars reiectanea vergil bucolio phyloſophers taken thynges abhorrid ſyckneſſe pouertie ſorowe reiectio parbrakynge reiectio ſanguinis yſſuynge oute bloudde atte mouthe nooſe vaynes reiectus ta tum caſte caſte awaye put forthe reijcio ieci ijcere caſte awaye dryue backe tityre paſcentes flumine reiice capella tityre dryue thy gotes doo fede awaye ryuer alſo refuſe put awayapulcius uero tanquam inutilem reiecerunt refuſed perſon vnprofytableterent phorin si altera illa magi inſtabit forſitā no reiiciat wil importunate perchaunce wyll put away reiicere iudices aut teſtes refuſe iudges wytneſſes reiicere parbrake vomytese • tonius auguſt senos ſextantes non exceſsit aut ſi exceſsiſſet reiiciebantur exceded twelue ounce yf paſſed caſte vp agayne relatio reporte reſpecte amonge logycians effecte relatyue father ſonne mayſter ſeruaunt huſbande wife withoute oone canne retayne name ſonne may withoute father wyfe withoute huſbande ſeruaunt withoute mayſter relati aerarios whiche ſome defaute mayſters maners called cenſores put numbre citiſens dyd pay tribute heedſyluer ſtraungers frome nother ſende awaye religatus ta tum faſte bounde relego legi legere rede agayne relicinus hathe good buſſhe heare well trymmed behynde relicina frons fayre large hygh forheed without heare relictus ta tum forſaken lefte relictus ſum mihi lefte alone religio oni relygion reuerende drede doubte leſte ſhall offendeplautus c • rgal alſo conſcience man mought ſay ſcruple conſcience religioſe fearefully doubtefully daungerouſely ſcrupulouſly religioſus ſa ſum relygious dredefulle doubtefull liuius 6 religionem uertere feare leeſte god diſpleaſed religionem inducere brynge feare goddis diſpleaſure •• etonius • auguſt religio eſt lefull huc introire niſi neceſſario caſte religio eſt enter neceſſitie chaſtely lefull religioſus ſa ſum religious alſo ſuperſtitious terent heauton plautus wyll manne ſette broche afterwarde religioni obſtringere whiche commonly ſayde haue conſcyence thynge religioni obſtringi bound cōſciēce religioni exoluere diſcharge mannes conſcyence religo looſe vnbynde relimino gyue lyght relinquo liqui relinquere leaue relinquere animam dye relinquit eum animus harte fayleth hym reliquatores whyche bene arrerage theyr accompte alſo whiche haue handes ſome part whiche ought haue payde reliqu • ae whyche lefte reliquium facere leaue omytte reliquus um remenaunt remayneth reliquum eſt reſte pli epiſ reluceo luxi cere ſhyne bryght reluctor tari contende lyttell ſhyppes whiche men lemnos vſed remedium remedye remeligo fyſſhe whyche cleanynge keale ſhyppe cauſeth hym tary remendo amende correct faut remeo retourne go back ageyn remigatio rowynge ſaylynge remiges whyche doo rowe galaye boote remigium rowynge ſhyp bote remigo rowe remigro go backe returne remillum thynge croked brode reminiſcor ſceris ſci calle agayne remembraunce reminiſcentia remembraunce whiche one mynde remiſſe fayntly without courage humbly sometyme meryly remiſsio remyſſion forgyueneſſe recreatyng mynde ſtudy labour remiſſus um gladde remytted forgiuen ſente agayne remitto miſi remittere ſende ſende agayne ſende backe releaſe forgyue graunt lette downe commytte remytte relinquiſhe leaue remittere animum putte awaye care vnbende louſe remittere ceſſe remittere aliquid adolecentiae pardon ſomwhat youth remittere nuntium gratiam habeo tibi qum copiam iſtam mihi poteſtatem facis plautus cap ut ego ad parentes remittam nuntiū thanke thou gyueſt leaue alſo authoritie maye ſende thy frendes prouyde el remiſsio releaſe loſynge withdrawyng oculorum remiſsio withdrawing looke remora lyttell fyſhe whyche retayneth great ſhyppe vnder ſayleci de os remorbeſco fall efteſones▪ ſicknes remordeo dêre tourment mynde make one heuy remores byrdes whyche flyght voyce ſygnyfyed thyng purpoſed folowed remoria place toppe hyl callyd auentinus remus ſtoode flyght byrdes aduyſed buyldynge rome remona dwellynge houſe remus remoueo êre remoue take awaye remouere moram make ye haſt ſpede remoror aris ari tary make abide remugio gini gire belowe lowe agayne render great ſowne remulco care remulculo proprely drawe greatte ſhyp barge laſſe veſſell tranſlation ſignifieth drawe thynge eaſyly remulcus lyttell bore barke remulinus ager remus felde perottus remuncopae inſtrumentes wherwith ſhippes dryuen lande remunero remuneror ari reward recompenſe good tourne remunera • recompenſe remus brother romulus whyche buylded rome renauciſcor ſceris ſci gette agayne ſum ſuppoſe repagulum doore wyndowe thynge ſhutteth cloſeth repages idem repandus a▪ um bent bowed brode backwarde ore old tyme repando dere bende backe reparo rare repayre reſtore fyrſte aſtate reparamen reparatio repayrynge reparation reparco parſi ſere ſpare repaſtinatio newe dyggynge aboute vynes alſo bryngyng grounde temper moche labour dyggynge repaſtinatus ta tū newe digged brought temper repaſtino dygge agayne vynes alter lande grounde ofte dyggynge labourynge repaſtinor nari efteſones dygged brought temper repauſo take reſte repedo go awaye go backe repello pul pellere put backe repel rependo di dere recompence repenſo ponder ouerſee iuge repente ſodaynely repentinus um ſodayne reperibitur ſhall founde repertor fyndeth repercutio cuſsi cutere ſtryke agayn reuerberate repercuſſus ſus reuerberation ſtrykynge often reperio reperi reperire fynde auenture ſometyme otherwiſeplautus repetere calle agayne hem repudiatus repetor howe nowe beinge one refuſed callyd agayne alta repetita ter • reherſed begynning farre ſought farre fette repetere poenas ab aliquo auengyd one repeto remembre quidem adoleſcē tulo repeto quendam principem nomine alternis diebus declamare alternis diſputare remembre whan boye one whyche prynce name dydde one daye declame nother daye diſpute repetenti memoria cal remembrance repeto tij tere aſke aſke often efteſoones reherce agayne alſo reply replumbo vnſowlderi •• ecō 〈◊〉 d▪ auro argent • repo repſi pere crepe runne rootes grounde repoleo liui lira polyſhe agayne repolleo lere moche able power doo colum 5 repolleſco ſcere ſette agayne place laye vp recite agayne hyde redelyuer reſtore reuoke repreſſe lay exaggerate heape one make grow agayne brynge agayne et quantum longis carpent armenta diebus vergeo 2 exigua tantum gelidus ro nocte reponet loke howe moche ſheepe longe dayes ſhall byte colde dewe oone nyghte growynge ſhall requyte reporto brynge backe agayne repoſco popoſci ſcere aſke agayne whyche myne owne dewe repoſitorium ſtorehowſe repoſitus repoſtus ta tum layd vppe hyde manet alta mente repoſtum iudicium paridis depe minde remayned iudgement parys gaue betwene goddeſſes whiche ſprange occaſyon reprimo mere refrayne lette reprobo reproue reprobus man reproued reproces ſharpe reptile thynge crepeth repto tare crepe moch alſo go ſoftly lyke ſnayle repudio forſake man forſaketh wife alſo refuſe abādon leue ter • repudio conſilium quod primum intenderam wyll nowe leaue counſayle fyrſte intended folowe repudium deuorce repudium remittere deuorced repudium renuntiare declare deuorce nunc repudium renuntiare iuſsit tibi plautus • •• wylled declare hath forſaken repudioſae nuptiae mariage foloweth ſone deuorceplautus perſa neceſsitate mala ut fiam facis uerum uideto vbi uoles nuptum date ne hac fama faciat repudoſas nuptias thou compelleſt nought take hede thou wylte mary reporte ſhall make ſuche weddynge ſhall ſoone diſſolued broken repueraſco ſcere efteſones chylde repugno repugne ſay contrary reſyſte repugnanter aduerbe whiche ſignyfyeth contrariouſly diſpleaſantlycicero de amicitia vt igitur monere moneri proprium eſt uerae amicitiae alterum libere facere non aſperé alterum pacienter accipere non repugnanter ſic habendū eſt nullam amicitus peſtem eſſe maiorem quam adulationē blanditias aſſentationem lyke therfore giue counſayle counſailed proprely belongeth frendeſhyp alſo tone euery thyng frankely tother take thynge pacientely diſpleaſantly conſydered frendſhyp peſtilence flatterye fayre wordes conſentynge thynges repugnantia repugnācy one thing agreeth nother repungo gere prycke agayne mutually diſpleaſe offende repulſa puttynge backe hym whiche eyther demaundeth looketh authoritie offyce repulſor oris putteth nother man backe repulſus put backe reputo tare thynke often conſyder moche reuolue mynde compt▪ alſo cut efteſoones requies reſte requieſco ſcere reſte take reſte requietus ta tum whiche reſteth requiro requiſiui requirere ſeke efteſones often requyre re occaſion ere nata melius fieri haud potuit quam factum eſt terent adelph occaſion begon coulde better haue ben doone alſo ſygnifieth meane repperi rem quo pacto nec fur nec ſotius ſies plautus ruden haue nowe founde meane howe thou ſhalt neyther thefe companion hym rem facere gayne wynne nunquam rem facies abi neſcis ine • care homines terent adelph thou ſhalte neuer gayne penye gette henſe thou canneſt noo ſkylle angle menne rem habere cum aliquo haue one meddell one ter eu re gerere haue make warres scipione aemiliano re affrica gerente polybius annalium conditor plinius lib 5 ab eo accepta claſſe ſcrutandi orbis illius gratia circunuectus eſt scipion emilianus making warres affrike polybius wrytar hiſtories certayne numbre ſhyppes conuayed aboute coſte inſerche parte worlde plautus epidico iuuare helpe deedes wordes onely amicus qui dubia iuuat vbi eſt opus frende caſe doubteful helpeth deedes deedes required quid iſti credam terent eunucho re ipſa indicat ſhal truſt hym deede ſelfe declareth verba ad rem conferre doo ſayth vſ que adeo ego illius ferre poſſum ineptias terent eunucho magnifica verba verba dum ſint verū enim ſi ad rem conferentur vapulabit hitherto ſuffre lewdeneſſe bragges longe wordes yf ſayth ſhall ſmart therfore vera deede trouthe matter dede reſalutatio courtayſe ſpeakynge hym ſpeaketh reſalutinge reſaluto determyned adiuged re controuerſa mater ſute re forenſis mater lawe respublica publike weale reſcindo ſcidi ſcindere cut breake ſundervergil • eor • 1 take awaye deſtroye make voyde repell acte lawe breake vp coelum reſcindere fratres ter ſunt conati thries brethern aſſayed breke vp heuen enter reſcio ſciui ſcire knowe thinge hydde kepte ſecrete alſo knowe thinge done whiche knowen reſciſco ſcere idem quod reſcio reſcribo pſi bere wryte agayne redelyuer repay money reſeco cut awaye ſuperfluouſe reſecare ad vinum pare quicke touche quicke mater reſecro crare praye deſire eftſones alſo aſſoyle one auowe reſegmen paringe man nayles reſero open thinge cloſed reſero tere ſow ſet agayne reſeruatio reſeruation kepyng ſome thynge reſeruo uare kepe part frome thinges reſerue reſes idis ydell frome accuſtumed labour occupacion reſex ſecis col lib 3 cut ſpringeth agayne beareth fruyte dyd reſideo reſedi reſidere reſt ſytte ſtande faſt reſido ſedi ſidere ſyt downe alſo abideplinius epiſto nam viennenſium vitia inter ipſos reſidunt noſtra late vagantur faultes men vienne doo abyde theym oures runne abrode euery knowen reſidet vultu doeth reſt appiere vyſagecic de 〈◊〉 quorum non ſententia ſolum ſed etiam nutu reſidebat autoritas whoſe ſentence onely alſo countenaunce autoritie reſted reſiduus um reſt remnaunt reſigno open ſealed ſometyme ſeale faſt alſo ſhyt ſometyme reſtore agayne alſo reſigne ſurrendre reſignatum aes wage ſtopped negligent ſeruice warres reſilio lij iire lepe backe ſteppe away quickely reſimus hath camoyſenoſe ſaye tourned vpwarde reſina roſyn lyke gumme whyche runneth tree reſinatus ſinata tum raſed dreſſed roſyn reſipio pui pere idem quod reſipiſco reſipiſco reſipui reſipiſcere retourne perfect vnderſtāding eftſones wiſe erred reſiſto reſtiti reſiſtere reſyſte withſtande reſoluo uere reſolue deſtroye pay dettes remoue vndo vnlowſe reſolutio neruorum palſey reſono nare ſowne agayne make eccho reſorbeo bui pſi bere poure diſgorge licour receyued reſpecto ſee often loue helpe reſpectus tus looke alſo reſpect regarde ne que eo reſpectu commorus diſceſſerat plini hauynge regarde thereunto departed reſpergo ſi gere caſt water licour ſprynkle reſpergimen ſprynklynge caſtynge licour •• r reſpicere helpe ſocour age tuis ſecundis rebus reſpice let ſe nowe thy proſperitie ſocoure reſpicit no deus god hath pytie v tacemodo plautus •• cch deꝰ reſpiciet no aliquis peace ſome god haue pitie v reſpicere ſe take hede haue regarde hym ſelfplautus •• udo • non ſoles reſpicere te cum dicas iniuſte alteri art thou wont take hede thy ſelfe whan thou ſayeſt wrong another manterent •• caut non tu te cohibes non te reſpicis non tibi exempli ſatis ſum wilte thou beware wilt thou take hede thy ſelf good example vnto reſpicio exi ſpicere loke backe haue regarde prouyde remedy kepe reſerue loue cice aul • orquato reſpiro take brethe alſo take cō forte retourne fyrſt ſtate si armis aut conditione poſitis aut fatigarione abiectis aut victoria detractis ciuitas reſpirauerit dignitate tua tibi fortuna vti licebit harneyſe eyther condicions peace beinge layde away weryneſſe partes beinge throwen awaye pulled awaye victory citie ſhall recouer fyrſt eſtimation thou ſhalt enioye thy poſſeſſions dignitie reſplendeo dere ſhyne reſpondeo di dere aunſwere appiere whan one called agree conſent lyke equall againſt one thing ſet lyenge agaynſte another reſponſio aunſwere reſponſito tare make gyue aunſwere pertayned proprely lawiars whyche hadde interpretation ceremonyes cice • pro c •• en reſponſo aunſwere reſponſum aunſwere reſponſus ſus ſui one thinge doeth agree another conſent conueniencye reſpuo ere refuſe reiect reſtagnó reſtagnare contayne holde water reſtat reſtare remayne thinge lefte ſtande backe reſyſte hoc reſtat remayneth abydeth reſtauro reſtaurare reſtore make agayne reſtibilis renewed ſowen agayne reſtibilis ager feelde ſowen two yeres togither reſtinguo xi guere ſtint put oute ceſſe fyre lyght thurſt reſtio oni roper alſoo hangeth hym ſelfe reſtipulatio puttynge pledgesplautus put gage pledge make aunſwere action reſtipulor aris ari make aunſwere lawe reſtite redy ſowen ploughed dygged reſtis halter corde rope bunche garlyke onyons reſtem ducere whan maydens childrē daunſe togither hande hande napkens leadynge one another ad reftim re redijt mater deſpayre deſperate reſtiro tare abyde tary reſtituo ere reſtore yelde agayne reſtitutio reſtitution reſto tare remayne tary hic nunc credit aliquam ſibi fallaciam portare ter ea hic reſtitiſſe gratia weeneth warke hym ſome falſhede tary ſtyll therforecicero de finibus nullam querentes voluptatem stoici reſtant stoike philoſophers reſiſt ſticke opynion ſekinge pleaſure reſtat mihi taryeth merit ſhal happen vnto reſtricte reſtrictim ſtraytely ſtrayte reſtringo xi ſtringere bynde ſtrayne backwarde bynde agayne reſtrayne ſometyme ſignifyeth lowſe apulci iumentum reſtrinxit abire que ſtabulo liberum ſinit lowſed horſe let hym ſtable libertye reſulto tare lepe agaynſte thinge rebounde rebelle leape ſteppe backe reſumo pſi ſumere take agayne reſume reſuo ere ſowe agayne make double ſtyche alſo ryppe vndo whiche ſowen vnſtytchesuct sumenti virilē togam tunica laticlaui reſuta ex vtra que parte ad pes decidit whan came fyrſte mannes age senatours cote beynge rypte bothe ſydes fell downe feete reſupinus na num vpryght bely vpwarde reſurgo rexi gere aryſe vppe reſurrectio reſurrection reſupino nare tourne vpwarde vpright reuoke calle backe differ peruerte retae tree growyng bankes ryuers ryuers retardatio taryenge retardo dare make tary rete ti nette retego retexi tegere diſcouer diſcloſe retento entare retayne often tempte eftſones retexo ere vntwyſte vntwyne vnwynde ſometyme twiſt wynde eftſones diſſolue rete culum lytle net retiarius caſteth nette proprely ſyghtynge apprehende aduerſarye rete nettes ſometyme ſignifyeth one nette reticeo cui ticère holde one peace ſpeake worde kepe ſecrete ſaye nothynge reticentia ſilence whan one holdeth peace reticulum lytle net wherin man heare woman truſſed reticulatus reticulata culatum made lyke nette reticulum cawle coyfe alſo bagge wherin meate caryed retinaculum ſo euer holdeth thinge ſtaye retinere holde vppe man fall ab retine obſecro terent heauton b obſecro quid tibi eſt • diſperij b perij miſera quid ſtupes antiphila oh holde vppe praye b alak ayleth vndone b ala euer borne doth thy hart fayle antiphila retineo nui nere holde agayne retayne kepe remembraunce terent adelph retinere reſtrayne let one frome doinge wolde pudore liberalitate liberos retinere ſatius eſſe credo quam metu thinke better reſtrayne child frome wanton willes ſhame liberalitie feare retinens kepeth ſtill retiolum cawle coyfe retondeo dere klyppe ouer retorqueo torſi quere caſt backewarde throwe ſhute agayne retorreſco retorreſcere burnedde ſunne retorridus da dum burned ſeryd retracto ctare calle backe reuoke thinge done drawe backe excuſe laye another man drawe vp retrahe traxi trahere pull drawe back drawe retribuo buere recompence retrica old writars called water wherwith garden watered retrimētum dragges thynge ſomtyme ordure dung retrò behynde retrocedo ceſsi cedere go backe retrorſum bacwarde retrorſus um turned backewarde retrudo ſi dere put backe retundo dere make blunt dull whyche ſharpe alſo beate often thynge retuſus um dull blunt contrary ſharp aliae agrorum partes cic de • quae acuta ingenia gignant aliae quae retuſa partes cō trayes whyche bringe forth ſharpe wyttes ſome bringe forth dull reualeſco ſcere recouered frome ſickeneſſe reueho uexi brynge cary backe agayne reuelatio reuelynge diſcloſynge thinge reuello reuellere plucke backe pull agayne reuelo diſcouer reuenio nire come agayne reuerendus worthy reuerence reuerens rentior rentiſsimus doeth reuerence reuerenter reuerently reuerentia reuerence honour doone one reuereor retis reri haue reuerence reuerſio retournebudeus reuertor teris ti retourne reuerto idem reuincio uinxi uincere verg • l gell bynde backe behynde bynde one handes behynde hym reuincere paratus eſt whyche lawyars ſaye paratus eſt verificare redy auerr̄ reuiſo ſere retourne ſee reuiuiſco ſcere reuyued reuoco uocare calle backe reuoke brynge agayne drawe backe rayſe frome deth reuocare pedem turne backe recule reuocare reſtore renewe item circa omnium ordinum ſtatum domi foriſ que aut correxit aut exoleta reuocauit aut etiam noua inſtituit moreouer concernynge ſtate al degree wel within houſe withoute eyther dyd amende renewed thoſe thynges oute vſe el ordayned newe ridiculate thinge laughe ridiculum idem alſo mocke ridiculus man whome men doo mocke lawghe ridicularius um idem quod ridiculum ridiculé folyſhly ridiculoſus um idem quod ridiculus ridiculoſé folyſhly doeth whan barke byte alſo angry brawle barke ripa water banke riparia byrde whyche breedeth water bankes ripae ſeu ripei mountaynes archadia riphaei mountaynes scythia riſcus cofer couered lether alſo lytle wyndowe riſibilis le lawghe riſus laughter riſus ſardonius lawghter without myrth madde cruell ſuch iriſh men vſe whan angry ritè dyrectely truely euen ſhulde rituales bookes wherin fourme enuy obſeruaunce betwixt louers one woman plautus aſinar riuinus wower idem quod riualis riuus ryuer broke riuulus lyttell broke riuo go watryng beſtis rixa braulynge contention rixoſe brawlynge mar rixoſus ſtryuer brawler rixor aris ari rixo contende brawlynge ¶r ante robigalia ceremonyes pertaynynge robigus preſeruatour corne robiginoſus um moche blaſted robigo honored romains goddeſſe ſuppoſed mought preſerue corne blaſtinge alſo vice corne called blaſting robigus whome olde romaynes named god preſerued corne blaſtynge roboraria place whiche ar paled roboreus ea eum oken tymber roboro fortifie roboſes old wryters vſed robore oke robur roboris hard oke alſo ſtrēgth hardenes body ſommetyme ſtrength hardnes thing generally robus olde wryters called redde colour alſo al maner matter many redde vaynes called robus alſo kynde wheate yeldeth fayre meale whiche nowe called redde wheate robuſtus ta tum ſtronge harde rodo ſi dere gnawe mouſe lyke beaſte dothe ſometyme detracte backbyte feſtus rodus da dum thyng vnperfect rude vnpolyſhed vnwrought rogamen mini deſyre rogatarii notaryes whyche requyred partyes eche theym ſhoulde promyſe plautus rogator rogatoris begger frome doore wede pull vp runſor oris oone name pluto callyd god helle vergil ruere alſo ouerthrowe rūne forth heedlynge quo moriture ruis maioraque uiribus audes whyther runneſt thou hedlynge ſlayne attempteſt thinges aboue thy puiſſannces alſo lyfte vp et ruit atram ad coelū picea craſſus caligine nubem ver geor beinge thycke lyfted vp heuen cloude blacke pytche ſometyme ſygnyfieth make great noyſe ruit manne maye clymme theym leg xii tabularum rupicapra wylde goote rupicias damnum dederis thou ſhalte paye yelde damage ruptus rupta ruptum broken braſte weryed torne rent ruralis le ruſticall vyllage rureſtris countreye citie towne ruricola huſbande man rurigena borne countrey oute citie great towne ruro rare countrey facion ruror raris rari dwelle countrey citie rurſus rurſum efteſones bakwarde parte ru ruris countreye oute citie houſbandrye vſed exercyſed ruſcum wande ruſpor ari ſerche dilygently proprely ſhrape henne dothe whan ſhe ſeketh meate ruſſus ruſſeus um redde ruſtica byrde lyke partryche hath longer byll ruſticanus na num ruſtycall countrey vyllage ruſticè ruſtycally vncourteyſly rudely ruſticane idem ruſticarius caria carium pertaynynge huſbandrye ruſticatim ruſtice aduerbe churlyſſhelye ruſticitas tati carlyſſhenes ſommetyme fearefulneſſe et ſi ruſticitas non vetat ouidius ipſa rogat yf foolyſhe baſſhefulneſſe lette nat ſhe makethe requeſte ruſticor caris cari dwelle countrey exercyſe huſbandrye ruſticus ca ruſticum ruſtycall vplandyſhe homely without curteyſye ruſticus alſo propre name man ruta rewe callydde alſoo herbe grace amonge lawyer dygged oute grounde ouen rutaceus um rewepliniu • rutatus ta tum made rewe rutatio rutus ructa • io belkynge rutellum lyttell mattocke rutilo lare te ſhyne ruto tare ructo fla • cicero belke breke wind vpwarde rutor idem rutrum mattocke rutum idem rutuba trouble id poſtea uiderimus varro nunc ſumus rutuba wyll afterwarde ſee nowe trouble rutubatri men dygge mattockes rutulus la lum brighte redde lyke cole kyndled rutupinum promontorium goore elbowe lande englande lyenge ſee whiche ſuppoſe norfolke saba citie ethiope sabaei people araby sabbatarius kepeth ſabbath daye sabbatū day reſte labour sabaoth plurelle wype thynge napkyn alſo territorie sacculus ſaccellus lyttell ſacke sacer mon hylle rome galatia wherin golde founde sacerdoralis le pertaynynge prieſte sacon amonge indian ſygnifieth bryght purple colour sacondion precious ſtoone bryghte purple colour saccularius crafty deceyuour whiche ſellynge grayne ſackes wylle conuey away parte saccus ſacke sacculus bagge sacellum chapelle sacer cra crum holy ſommetyme curſed deteſtable sacer ignis ſycknes wherin vehement inflamation burnyng body sacer locus place conſecrate dedicate sacer morbus fallynge ſyckeneſſe sacerdos dotis prieſte sacerdotium prieſthode ſometime benefyce ſpirituall promotion sacrum uia ſtreete rome peace made betwene romulus tacius whiche vanquyſhers paſſed triūph vnto capitol sacramenta taken men warreiuuenall • sacramentum othe amonge v chriſten men ſignifyeth ſygne wherin contayned diuyne myſterie callyd ſacrament sacramento contendere ſweare sacramento teneri ſworne sacrarium ſextrie veſtrie wherein kepte thynges halowed relykes sacratae leges lawes whiche enacted ſo dothe offende agaynſt theym accurſed sacratio conſecration sacratius holy sacrator dothe conſecrate sacrificium ſacrifyce sacrifico care ſacrifice conſecrate aſke forgyuenes god sacrificulus prieſte sacrilegium theft taking away thynges halowed callyd sacrilege sacrilegiſsimus errant thefe ſtelynge thynges halowed sacrilegus violently taketh awaye ſtealeth thynges halowed thynges vnhalowed holy place sacrimum muſte newe wyne sacriſcrinius keepeth kynges letter recordes concernynge crowne bokes great affaire sacrium kynde aumbre whiche commeth scithia sacro crare dedicate halowe sacroſanctus ta tum conſecrate halowid ſolemne othe taken sacrum thynge dedicate god alſo ſacrifice ſometyme temple churche paulus iureconſultus sunt aurem ſacrilegi qui publica ſacra compilarint alſo ſacra ſignifye holy wordes alſo charmes sacrum promontorium great mountayne rocke ſouthweſt part spayne lyenge ſee callyd nowe capeſainct vincent sadducei men ſpeciall ſeete among iewes beleued reſurrectiō angel ſpiritis saeculū proprely ſpace hundred yeres commonly taken ſpace tyme wherin one facion worlde hath contynued saepe oftentymes whervnto ſhyppemen doo bynde oores rowe eaſyly scalpo pſi pere ſcratche alſo graue mettalle scalprum ſcalpellū inſtrument wherwith thyng ſcraped rubbed alſo ſurgeons inſtrument wherewith taketh bedde alſo balke vntilled betwene two forowes scamonea herbe iuyce whereof vſed medicine purge coler vehemētly venemous leaueth war matter behynd doth expell scandalides kynde date scandalum occaſyon ſynne gyuen nother hym ſynneth scandinauia yle north occean ſee quantitie wherof neuer founde scandix dicis herbe lyke cheruyll ſweter hath whyte floure lyttell roote scando di dere clymme scandulaca herbe whiche runneth vppon corne iuye dothe tree scandulae ſhyngle whiche tyles wod wherwith dyuers church couered scandulum cōtectum houſe couered ſhyngle wooden tyles scanſile whiche maye clymmed gone vppon scanſio clymmynge vp scapha boote scaphiarius boteman scaphium baſon veſſelle receyue vryne ordure scapilium ſpace betwene ſhulders scaprum knyfe wherwith vynes lyke thynges cutte scaptenſula place macedoni • ſyluer dygged scaptia olde citie italy wherof came scaptia tribus scapula hynder parte ſhulders scapularis boye wenche whiche oft beaten aboute ſhulders scapularis ueſtis garment whiche couereth onely ſhoulders scapus heade popie lyke herbes wherin ſedes lykewiſe huſke grape wherin graynes contayned scarabaeus fly blacke ſhell huſke called bytell whiche breedeth cowe ſhardes black alſo kind thē hath horne like hart scarabaeus aquilam prouerbe applyed ſuche endeuour ſelf diſpleſure thoſe puiſſant thanne scarifico care launce open ſore matter corrupted may iſſue scarificario launcynge scarus fyſhe whiche dothe chewe lyke beaſte ſome menne doo ſuppoſe gylte heed scatebrae bollynge ryſynge vppe water ſpryng ſourges water scateo tere runne braſt water dothe narowe ſtrayte place scaturigo ginis ſcaturies braſtynge oute water thynge lyke maner scatu • io ire runne abrode alſo ſpringe growe abroode ſomme herbes done scaturitio runnynge water dothe scauri whiche haue toe ſwollen ankley croked may goo faſte alſoo honourable houſe romaynes scazon ti kynde meterdonatus vergil sceleratè myſcheuouſly scelerator ti polluteth defileth sceleratus vnto whome pro 〈◊〉 seducere arrogantiam lay aparte pryde seductilis whyche maye deceyued sedulo deede dyligentely withoute faynynge sedulitas dylygence moche care sedulus dylygente playnely without crafte dothe thynge diligently sedum herbe callydde syngreene howſeleke seges ſegeris corne whan ſtandeth ſome tyme grounde falowed redye receyue corne segeſta towne italye segeſtria ſtrawe layde lyghter wherin greate men borne ſeruantes segmenta certayne lynes ymagyned whiche coſmographers doo deuyde worlde porcions whiche callid alſo paralleli wherby diſtance place founden segmenta cuttynges thynge ſometyme partes worlde diuyded ſonne alſo gardis like thynges ſowed garmentes segmentarius maketh cloth gold segmentum piece cutte frome anye thinge mettall ſtone alſoo bee colar whiche aboute womennes neckes doo take purfyll womannes gowne maye welle taken garde border aboute garmente segmentatus ta tum may ſayde anye thinge whyche hathe border trayles ſynely wroughte ſmall peces faſtned theron mettall tymber segmentatae ueſtes garded pourfylled garmentes segnis ſlowe bulle wytted barayne segnitas pro ſegnitia ſlouthfulneſſe segniter ſlowely segnities ſlowneſſe dulneſſe baraynnes solearius paten maker soleatus ta tum ſhodde suetonius auguſt plautus caſtel solemne accuſtomed solemnia feaſtes holydayes solemniter ſolemnely solennis ne annuall yerely whiche done euery yere soleo olibanū latin thus maſculus sterto tui tere route whan one ſlepeth steſichorites numbre eight diſe ſo called ſepulchre steſichorus poete whiche made figure like eyght dyſe steſichorus famouſe poete whome writen whanne infant cradelle nyghtyngale ſatte mouthe dyd ſynge ſygnyfienge ſhulde ſweeteſt poete euer afore hym alſo founde fyrſte ſyngynge ſonges daunſe stibadium chaire couche made herbes houſe stillo droppe stilpo phyloſopher borne cytie megara grece whiche countreye beinge burned wyfe childern loſte fyre eſcaped departynge alone whan kynge demetrius aſked hym yf loſte thynge anſwered haue loſte nothyng myne carie meanynge therby vertue whiche onely propre goodes wyſe mā may taken hym toke away hym stilpones dwarfes stimulo prycke stimulatio pryckynge feruent mouing doo thynge stimulator prycketh stimuleus um whyche done pryckynge stimulus gode wherwith ox ar driuen stingo ſtinguo guere put lyght stipa ſtupa towe stiparius ia ium pertaynynge ſtoppyng beatynge harde togyther stipatores whiche frayte ſhyp lay ſuche fardelles burdeynes caryed alſo whiche kynges gard alway perſon stipatus enuyronned men defended princis garde stipendialis le pertaynynge wage stipendiarius um whiche payeth tribute ſome callyd contributarie fyndyng army defence contray stipendiatus taketh wage stipendioſus hath bene oftentymes hyred retayned warres stipendior diari hyred retayned warres stipendium wage proprely gyuen ſouldiours alſo ſubſidie payde princis stipe pitis ſtake alſo ſtycke stipo ſtop chynkes clyftes proprely ſhyppes botes towe pytche alſo enuyronne intent defende one imperata non feci ignorant daunger hauyng experience lyght warnyng howe moch coſt dyd thoſe thynges commaunded stare firmum ſtande faſte stat per per te per illum whanne anye cauſe thynge done si fides parum thou arte ſmall credence statur ſtande stoecades foure iles frenche ſee agaynſte languedocke stoici ſecte philoſophers affirmed griefe moughte happen wyſe man felicitie onely vertue stola dis dere craſhe make noyſe lyke cordes whan drawen stridon towne dalmacia ſaynct hierome borne striga rewe thynges whanne layde lengthe alſoo ridge lande wherof commeth ſtrigatus ager striges without houſe walk without couerynges subducere go away ſtelthe noo man perceyue sub iugum mitti ſubdued proprely whan battayle vanquiſhed vanquiſhers cauſed thre ſpeares ſet vp lykes galowes conſtrayned vanquyſhed go vnderneth token ſubdued whyche greatteſt reproche moughte deuyſed subluere vnderwaſhe water whyche runneth lowe vnder banke hyllecaeſar de • ell galli lib 2 waſheth foote thereof alſo waſhe ſomewhat cleane subluſtris tre hath ſome lyght subluines diſeaſe cattell whiche betwixte cleys fete cice pro planco sub manu habere haue hande sub manu eſſe hande redy sub manu hande forthewith sub manus eaſily handſomly bono animo e plautus melite negotium omne iam ſuccedit ſubmanus good chere matter come paſſe handſomly lepidè hoc ſuccedit ſub manus negotium mattier 91 vergilius super haec ouer super priamus ſuper hectore priamꝰ hector hac ſuꝑ ſcribā ad te rhegio mater wil write vnto frō regiū super propter nec ſuper ipſe ſua molitur laude laborem takethe peyne prayſe super valdé accenſa ſuꝑ vergilius thoſe wordes ſhe beinge kendlyd ſtyred superaddo dere putte adde superbé proudely superbiter idem superbia pryde superbio ire proude superbiloquens ſuperbiloquus ſpeaketh proudely hautely superbiloquentia proude haute wordes superbos olde wryters vſed mortuosplautus amphi deed bycauſe pompe whiche burienge faciam ego hodie te ſuperbum niſi hinc abis wil kyl thou gette hen superbum bellum vniuſt vnhappy warrevergil superbus proude ſometyme magnifyke noble alſo hyghe ornate garnyſſhed ryche wycked supercido dere falle supercilioſus ſoure countenance supercilium ouerbrowe ſommetyme ſygnifyeth pride grauitie alſoo haunce whiche ouer doore superciliū attollere ſtately proude supercilium ponere laye aparte pryde ſtately countenance supercreſco ſcere ouergrowe supercubo bare lye ouer superduco cere put lay superedo dere eate thynge supereſsit ſupererit ſhall lyue left lyue supereſt lyueth lyue supereſt plentie thanne ynough aliis quia defit quod amant aegre eſt terent pho • tibi quia ſupereſt dolet bicauſe lacke thynge loue diſcontent thou arte ſorye thou haſte thou nedeſt terent hea • supereſſe reſte reſydue porro auſculta quod ſupereſt fallatiae yet reſydue craft deceyte defende pleade one cū ctariſe ne ſi ſupereſſet eriperet legibus reū wolde tary leſte yf came ſpake hym ſhulde delyuer offender superexto tare remayne ouer superficiariae aedes houſes buylded lande nother man buylded superficiarius hathe houſe owne buylded man grounde payeth therfore quyte rent superficies ouermoſt part thing superfoetatio oone conception chylde superfluo fluxi fluere abounde ſuperfluouſe superfluè ſuperfluouſely superfluo idem superfluus um ſuperfluous ••• onius superforaneus um idem superfundo dere poure vppon supergredior gredi go aboue supera ſupra superiacio ieci iacere caſte lay superiiceo ſuperieci iicere caſt vpon laye vppon superi whiche ben heuen superincido dere falle superior hygher superior aetas tyme age paſſed superlachrimo wepe droppe vpon supermeo go ouer ſlyppe ouer supernato natare ſwymme ouer supernati haue hinder part thighes next buttockes cut away supernè hygh aboue supernia inwarde part hindermoſt parte thyghes nexte buttockes cutte supernus na num high ouer superna regio high countrey supernumerarius whiche ſurpluſage aboue true number supero rare go ouer alſo vanquiſhe ouercome alſo ouerlyue ſomtyme kylle quod ſuperat whiche lefte ſurpluſage superpondium ouerweight whiche added iuſte weight superſedeo dêre omytte leaue doo thynge ci seruio superſedeas hoc labore itineris take peyne come nowe forbeare peyn takyng iourney superſede iſtis rebus plautus epidico plautus perſa plin epiſt 102 let theſe thinges alone superſede iſtis uerbis let theſe wordis paſſe holde thy runge superſedi ſcribere forbare wryte left vnwriten superſtes ſtitis ouerliueth remaianeth alyue afterthat deed alſo alyue ſometyme preſent olde writer callyd superſtites wytneſſes superſtes ſaulfe deos quaeſo ut ſis ſuperſtes beſeche god ſaue longe mought lyue alſo preſent superſtitem utrun que monui ne inuiſi abeant aduyſed ſhoulde departe dyſpleaſure superſtitio ſuperfluous vayne religion deuotion honouryng ought honored vaine reuerēce feare towarde thing wherin efficacye power illuſyon dyuelle diuination cryenge fleinge byrdes obſeruation time dreames lyke vanites superſtitioſi tymorous without cauſe fearinge god diſpleaſed none offence done fyrſte ſoo callyd bycauſe contynually prayid offred goddis preſerue theyr chyldern mought ouerlyue finally euery vndiſcrete vnreaſonable deuocion religion may callyd superſtition superſtito ſtirare make hoole recouer frome deathe superſto ſtare ſtande vppon superſtruo ſtruxi ſtruere buylde superſum supereſſe abounde remain vanquiſhe ſuperfluous indure superuacaneus um ſuperfluous superuacuus um neceſſarie superuaganea auis diuinours ſothſayers callyd byrde cried toppe thynge superuenio nire com vnloked vpryghtehoration bealye vpvpwarde ſomtyme ſygnifieth hyll hygh place suppar almoſte euen supparaſitor taris tari folowe flatter man dyner supparium clothe curtayne hanged vp interlude playde supparus uel ſupparum ſmocke alſo topſayle ſhyppe suppedaneum foote ſtoole suppedito tare ſubdue minyſter ſufficiently alſo oppreſſe plautus aſinar suppedito tare endure ac ſtomacho nō queo labori ſuppeditare ſtomake wyll lette indure laboure alſoo furnyſhe expenſes gyue moche man wolde haueterent brautont nam ſi illi pergam ſuppeditare ſumptibus menedeme mihi illaec uero ad raſtros re redit surely menedemus yf wold gyue hym moche wolde ſpende thynge wolde brynge poynt rake lyuynge suppeditare ſubdewe treade vnder nunc uideo iudicio mecum contendere non uis ubi ſuppeditari turpiſsimum ſuperare pulcherrimum eſt nowe perceyue thou wylte contende iudges great ſhame ſubdued moche honeſtie haue better suppetiae ſuppetias ayde ſuccours suppeto tii tere aſke priuily craftily suppetit redyneſſe supperior ari ſuccour ayde plautus aſinar suppetunt dictis data aut facta non ſuppetunt dictis data perfourmeth promyſed vtinam quae dicis dictis facta ſuppetant wold god thou woldeſt thou ſayeſt wolde god thy dedes agree thy wordes plautus ruden plautus amphit suppetit lucrum gayne ſufficiente re ita ſupperit matter ſo requireth suppetias mihi brynge ſuccoures ayde suppetias adueni come helpe suppetias ferre ayde ſuccour suppilo ſteale vnderhand craftily supplanto tare putte vnder foote ouerthrowe ſupplant deceyue preuentynge one hynderance dammage vnderplante ſet tree vyne supplaudo ſi tanto magi tamarindi fruite growynge indiavergil tree wherof like palme date tree fruite ſower lyke grene damſins whiche medicinable aſſwagyng heate cholere tamaritae people aſia farre frome ſee callyd caſpium tamarix ricis herbe whyche bearethe floures twyſe one yere tamen withſtandyng alſo yet tamen malicia non diſcedis yet wylte thou departe thy malyce sommetyme ſignifieth forthewith laſte ſoo quod potero faciam tamē ut pietatem eolam wyll doo maye ſoo withſtandynge omytte duetie father tametſi alwaye taminia wild grape growing woddes tam ne olde wryters vſed eouſ que vntyll tanager riuer lucania betwene campania calabria tanagra towne perſide tanais great ryuer northe parte worlde whyche dyuydeth europa aſia tanaquil wife tarquinius priſcus kynge romaynes tanaus kynge siria tandem laſte ſometyme leſte waye alſo vneth withſtandynge tandiu ſo longe tango retigi tangere touthe meue vnderſtande perceyue come tangere ulcirs rubbe gaide placeturp • ilius ſpeake one thynge whiche greueth hym tangere deceyue tetigit aures meas came myn earesplautus • ruden tanis principall citie egypte moyſes dyd ſhewe meruayles tanos ſtone kynde emeralde grene blacke tanquam lyke tantalides progeme tantalus tantali horti prouerbe ſygnifienge good thynges hande whiche withſtandynge man may vſe tantalus kynge poetes faine turmented hell hunger thyrſte tanti ſo moche worde doth pertayne byenge ſellynge tantidem pryce tandidem idem tanti aeſtimo tantifacio tanti pendo ſette ſo moche ſo moche eſteme • tantillus la lum tantulus um diminutiue tantus tantiſper ſo longe tantopere ſo moche ſo vehemently tantum onely tantum non almooſte terent heautont tantum ſat habes arte thou content tantummodo onely tantundem periculum ſo great dangier tanuina wylde vyne callyd alſo labruſca h thalamus chamber huſbande wyſe lye togither thalaſsicus chamblette thalaſsio uide talaſsio thaſſus bonorum prouerbe applyed promyſe great thynges mā wolde ſay worlde countray welthe thalaſſo meli lycour made honye ſalte water rayne water put veſſell raſed pytche thales philoſopher whiche one ſeuen wyſe men grecia thaleſtris quene amaſones whiche came kynge alexander three hunderde womenne intente haue iſſue hym menne whanne ſhe perceyued ſhe ladyes ſpedde departed home agayne thali lyekes garlyke oynyons whan growe myddell ſ • alke betwene blade heed rote thalia one grace whiche auncent poetes dyd ſuppoſe one doughters iupiter gyuers dilectable ſpeche pleſant pronunctatiō thamaras whiche fyrſte playd harpe without ſyngynge therto thamnos latine arbuſtum thanatos mors latyne thapſus yle sicile thapſia herbe lyke ſenell hathe yelowe flowre flatte rounde ſede tharia pyckelle wherein fyſſhe ſalted kepte tharſos citie cilicia thaſia almonde thaſia nux callyd alſo graeca thaſij menne ile callyd thaſus egypte thaſium certayn wine egipt thauma greke meruaile myracle theatralis le theatricus ca cum whiche pertayneth theatrum theatridium diminutiue theatrum theatrum place made halfe round wherin people aſſembled beholde playes ſondrye ſbate mentes ſometyme ſygnifieth multitude beholdeth theboe arum theba thebe be name city wherof one egipte buildid buſirides boeotia buylded cadmus nother cilicia andromaches wyfe hector borne thebaicae thebaides date beſte forte thebais idis ido countraye egipt alſo name boke made statius poete thebanus na num man thebe theca caſe ſhethe ſcaberde boxe theleboae people yle callid capreae whiche lyeth agaynſt naples theleboij people ile capreas thelephus kynge whyche camme ayde troyanes ſlayne achylles theligonium herbe whyche hathe beries lyke olyue thelphuſa citie arcadia thelphuſsiū uel thelphoſsion cite boeotia pyndarus prayſed bacchus thelypteris ſheferne female ferne thema matis thynge purpoſed diſputed reſoned alſo figure wherin aſtronomers doo write ſtate heuen placinge ſettyng planettes ſuche ſignes degree tyme man natiuitie whan thynge ſhall happen ſerche thembinacha contrey called alſo nemia theme olde towne ile lipres braſſe fyrſte founde themis one ſyſters iupyter ſhe callid goddeſſe whiche cōmanded men aſke whiche leful woman callyd themis whiche called alſo carmentis ſomtyme taken fa lefull themiſcyra cite capadocia afterward callyd caeſaria themiſones people licia themiſtius philoſopher wrate cō mentaries ariſtotels warkes themiſtocles noble capitain athemenſis whiche beinge expelled countrey commen xerxes king perſia ſent hym great armye agaynſte athenienſes whan perceyued countrey peryll diſtroyed dranke poyſon chaſe rather dye eyther vnfeythfull xerxes el diſtroy countrey broilid roſted dried torridae zonae two girdels imagined firmament euery ſide equinoctial line vnder whiche gyrdels people whiche inhabyte burned feruent heat ſonne bicauſe ſonne abideth lōgeſt thoſe ii place ar alſo named tropicus cancri tropicus capricorni torridus da dum dried burned tortilis le whiche bent bowed torris ſtycke fyre tortiuum vinum wyne laſte preſſe torto tare tourment vehemently ſowerly grymly toruinus apparell woman heed torus bedde ſomtyme made herbes wounden togyther torus brawnes armes leggis fleſhe myxte ſynewes toroſus um myghty ſtronge brawnes legges armes torſio ſionis theodorus gaza longolius ſuppoſed ſturgion paulus iouius contrary opinion torulus lyttell bedde toruê ſturdyly looke toruitas tatia ſturdynes toruus ua uum cruel ſturdy loking toſtus um toſted roſted totidem verily ſo many euen many tot many toties ſo many tymes totus ta tum hole euery whyt toxicum venym poyſon ¶t ante r trabales certayne tourment trabalis le pertayning beame trabalis clauus yron pin gret nail wherwith bemis ar made faſt rafter trabea cerklet kyrtell worn kynges vnder theyr mantell trabiea nauit ſhyp made gret bemes trabs trabes beame houſe trachale ouer part fiſhe callid mutex purple colour made trachea weſon pype lunge trachelū midle part tho faſt ſhip trachelus chine mā beaſt heed haunche trachida trachina trachurus ſuppoſe banſtykle trachinia kynde roſes perfytelyted lyke call french roſes traconia roughnes within eie liddes traconitidis parte iudea tractabilis treatable may intreatid tractare handell tractim length longe tyme ſpace tracto tare commytte truſt man traditio tradition traduco duxi ducere brynge oone place brynge ouer tranſlate oute one language nother traducere tempus paſſe tyme brynge vp nouryſhe traduces vynes tree tranſlated tragonis ſiue tragion tree growynge candy lyke iunyper iuyce wherof lyke mylke waxethe thycke lyke gumme tragum lyke tyzan made wheate alſo fyſhers nette callyd dragge tragonia herbe nowe callid taragon late ſene realme whiche hath taſt lyke gynger whiche herbe layde lefte ſyde conſumeth ſplene tragopa byrde ethiopia greatter thā egle hath hed horne like gote tragopogus fyſhe callyd barbyll tragoriganon herbe whiche ſuppoſe callyd peny royalle growyng wylde tragula iauelyn barbyd heed traguriū ile ſee callyd hadriaticū ▪ trigon fyſhe callyd thornebacke tragulam inijcere practiſe deceyte traha dray ſlyd drawen wtout wheles trahax acis couetous perſone whiche draweth thynge vnto hym vergilius trahere diem noctem tempus paſſe day nyghte tyme plautus trinammo cic •• te que ir • exilium trahere tary que egomet adeo cumillis una ibidem traho ſelfe taryed longe trahere liue et uosut turā tranquillā que fortunā traheretis mea perfeci uigilantiā vygilancy brought paſſe ye ſhulde lyue ſure quiete proſperitie traho xi draw leade deferre delay extend remoue prolong traiicto reci ijcete leade ouer carye ouer brynge ouer ſtryke traiectitia pecunia money caried ouer ye ſee tra • ectus tus paſſage traiectio idem trallis citie lidis phrigia trallianus man citie tralucidus da dum clere man maye loke trama vnder garment trames mitis croſſe waye trano nare ſwymme ouer tranato tare ſwymme ouer tranquille ſoftely without noyſe tranquillitas tranquillitie reſt quyetenes tranquillo lare make quiete tranquillus la lum quiete reſt peaſible tranquillum eſt fayre wether 〈1 paragraph〉 tranquillus locus good place reſte place quietenes trans ouer one place tranſactio agrement vpon cēmunicatiō tranſactus ū paſſed lōge agone achiued tranſalpina gallia fraunce ſyde mountaynes trāſalpinus ū ouer moūtains alpes tranſcendo dere go ouer excede tranſcindo ſcidi ſcindere cut ſonder vergilius tranſcribere giue deliuer turne tot incaſſum fuſos patiere labores et tua dardaneis trāſcribi ſceptra colonis wilt thou turnus ſuffre thy labour loſt thy realm giuen inhabytantes troy agretius tranſcribere tranſpoſition poſſeſſion one tranſcribo pſi bere write copie ſometyme tranſlate tranſcurro rere runne forthe tranſcurrit aeſtas ſommer paſſed tranſcurſus u courſe tranſcurſu paſſynge forthe tranſenna loupe loke alſo windowe caſement alſoo rope ſtretched ſnare trappe tranſeo ſiui ſii ſire go forthe paſſe euer paſſe tranſire domum go home tranſeunter paſſynge ouer transfero tuli ferre cary bryng one place tranſlate one langage one poſſeſſiō others tranſlatus ū participle transfigo xi gere thruſte transfuga departeth people capytayne vnto parte ennemies theym ſuſpected tyme truce transfodio dere dygge transfoſſus ū digged ſtriken transfiguro rare tranſfourme turne nother fygure transfretatio paſſage ouer ſee transfreto tare paſſe ouer ſee transfugere ad hoſtes goo yelde hym contrary parte transfugium yeldynge ennemies transfulgeo ſhyne transfundere tranſlate frome one libentius omnes meas laudes ſi modo ſint aliquae meae laudes ad te transfuderim ci dol • haue wyllyngly tourned prayſe yf haue prayſe vnto transfugio gere fle place place transfundo fudi fundere poure oute one veſſell nother transgredior deris di paſſe go ouer beyonde excede tranſgreſſe law commaundemente transgreſsio figure retorike mā leaueth principal matter entreth thing returneth matter cōmonly call digreſſion transgreſſus u paſſing ouer ſee tranſigere uiram paſſe lyfesaluſt plaut amphit terent andria tranſigere alſo perfourme tranſigo egi igere dryue furth treate mater agree condeſcende come point hapneth betwene men contend ſomwhat tranſilio ſiliui ſilii ire leape ouer tranſitio ſitus paſſing ouer going forth tranſitorius ū ſhortly paſſeth translatio trāſlation brynging frō one place another trāſle go ere rede ouer tranſluceo cere ſhyne transmarinus na um whiche cōmeth beyonde ſe transmigratio departinge goynge frō one place dwell diſcrimen eſcape danger tranſmitto miſi mittere ſende one place go runne quickly ſend ſhortly quickly paſſe ouer water tranſmoueo êre remoue frō one place tranſnato ſwym ouer sueton de claris grā turbatio trouble turba multitude aſſemblye people quid illec turba eſt nūnam ego perij terent eunucho terent heautont multitude yonder vndoone euer alſo ſignifieth trouble propter eam haec turba que abitio euenit hyr ſake trouble diſſenſion turbaſis ſterche turbella lyttell trouble turbidé troublouſely turbidus troublous clere turbinatus ta tum rounde ſharpe lyke toppe turbino nare make ſharpe amor ualeat ne ſciam ſuche foole knowe loue may power loue valere á morbo recouerid fro ſicknes valere alſo ſignifieth worthe terent andria valeat farewel care hym imo habeat ualeat uiuat cum illa vertebra place bodye boone doo meete knytte togyther ſuche wyſe ſynewes may tourne lyghtly vertere terga rounne awaye flye battayle vertere ſolum goo dwelle oute man propre countrey vertere verſuram facere vertere ſtultitiae repute foly thyng plautus epidic vertere uitio put blame one quis erit uitio qui id non uerta • tibis wyll put blame vertere tranſlate▪ interprete oute one tunge nother vnus ex omnibus oone alone onely ¶v ante voberca towne bilbo spain vocabulum denomination thynge vocalis le lowde alſ whiche hathe voyce alſo vowell vocalitas tune ſounde voyce vocatio callynge vocator caller vociferatio cryenge vociferator crieth vociferor aris ari crie cry loude vocifero idem vocito calle often voco care call byd aſke voconia kynde peares vocula lyttell voyce ſomtyme obloquie voculatio accent ſpeche vola myddes hande fote taken ſoole fote volaticus ca cum flieth goth awaye ſodeynly flittinge volatilis le flye volatus volatura flight volema great peare wardyn volens willynge volenter wyllyngly volentia volito tare flye often vide com volo flye runne go quycklye faſt volo uis nolui uelle volo tuam gratiam deſyre fauour volo te wolde ſpeke volones bondemen rome whiche warres cartage whan lacked romanes offred ſelfes fyght maſters bycauſe dyd willyngly withoute conſtraynt called therfore called volones volſella inſtrument plucke heares frō body face volua vulua volubilis le eaſyly tourned volucer cri ſwift lyght volucra beaſt whyche eateth tender vine volueres byrdes foules volucrior ſwyfte voluctis ere thinge doth flye volucrum byrthe woman volumen mini booke ſometyme part boke called volume voluntas tati voluntarius um voluntary willynge voluo uere wrappe tourne voluox voluola idem quod conuoluolus lytle wurme many legges whiche eateth leuys vynes tree volup voluptas volupe delectable volupia voluptia goddeſſe voluptie delectation voluptabilis le reioyceth sal ca voluptaria loca placis pleaſure voluptas tati inordinate reioycinge delectation thynges worldly carnall voluptuarius voluptarius gyuen carnall delectation voluptuoſus um voluptuouſe vnſatiable carnall pleaſure delectation volutabrū place ſwyne walow volutabundus aſtronomy vragus olde writars vſed orcus dethe vrbanatim vrbanè lyke gentyl manne courteyſely gratiouſely vrbanicani milites ſouldyours citie vrbanitas courteſye good maner gentilneſſe ſpeche vrſellus lytle yonge beare vruat ennius vſed circundat vruare alſo drawe furrowe plowgh aboute place vruum plowghe beame crooked part plowghe vrinum adell egge vrino vrinor ari dyue vnder water urere burne turmented vexed vror reris uri bourned vrſa two figure ſterres one called vrſa maior vrſa minor vrſus beare vrſa ſhee beare vrſinus na um beare vrtica nettyl alſo fiſſhe paulus iouius populo grata ar que iucunda ſunt nihil tam populare quàm pacem quàm concordiam quàm otium reperiemus put caſe mought ſe perfitely thinges pleſaunte delectable vnto people ſhoulde nothinge fynde ſo moche deſyre peace concorde vacacion laboure te ad vt eſt dementia se man foly vt iſtum dij deae que perdant beſeche god halowes ſend myſchief ci bru vt poſtquàm nam vt illos de republica libros breuiſsimū tempus ſhort timepli pan ad id tempus tyme ad ſapientiam huius nimius nugator fuit regard wyſedom fole ad illam faciem ita ut illa eſt ut emerem ſibi plautus mercator mandauit mihi adſciſco ſcere ioyne take whan one ioyneth another hym auctority taketh one ayde office adſcriptitii men warre whyche taken armye ſupplye place ſlayne wyſe lacked aſcripti appoynted inhabyte townes great age aetatem aduerbe ſignifieth longe time lam dudū aetatem lites ſunt inter eos hath bē variance betwene long time aeterné euerlaſtyngely aeterno nare make perpetuall aethereus um firmament anaxagoras putteth element fyre aethiopia great countrey affrike conteynynge many regyons callyd ethiope wherin founde people beaſtes ſerpentes meruaylous forme hathe weſt mountaynes callid athlantes eaſte extendeth march egypt ſouth hath ſee occean northe parte incloſed ryuer callyd nilus aethiopicus ca cum ethiope aethiopiſſa woman ethiope aethiops aethiopis man ethiope aethon one horſes phebus wynde argeus um citie argo arg •• plurali citie laconia argiletum ſepulchre argus alſo place poſters clay dygged alſo ſtrete rome boke ſellers •••• lled arg •••• boke ſellers dwelling ſaid ſtrete callyd argilerum argimyſſy thre lytle iles aſias ra li 13 iles mitelenae leſbus argis citie argo argo ſhyppe wherin iaſon cō panye ſayled colchos wynne f • • e golde argolicus ca cum argo argonautae noble men accompanyed iaſon vnto colchos argo ſingulari argi plurali citie far athene nother achara alſo countray part greece plautus arguere aliquē pecuniae interuerſae accuſe one ſtealynge money arguta diuiſio ſubtill diuiſion argutū caput ſharpe pikyd hedde lyke ſugar lofe argyranche ſyluer ſykeneſſe argyraſpidae men bearyng ſhildes ſyluer argytitis ſpume fome ſyluer •• adne lady wife theſeus forſoke notwithſtandyng ſhe hadde ſauyd life aricia city italy aricinum noemus woode ſayd citye numa kynge romaynes fayned ſpeke aegeria fayry plautus aricinus lacus brooke aricia aridus homo dry felowe thynge maye goten ſome call hym peltplautus pynchebeke arimaſpi peple north part europa whiche haue one eye theyr ſorched fyght contynually ••• phon ariminū citye italy arimphaei people north part aſia whiche though haue onely woodes theyr dwellynge onely beryes theyr ſuſtynance yet kepe iuſtice peace amonge ſelues temperate maners herodotꝰ ge •• u plinius arinca corne called rye arion famouſe harper maryners wolde haue throwen ſee haue money deſyryng let hym play ſonge harpe dyed afterwarde lepte water dolphyn receyuyng hym backe brought hym lande lyue ariſtathea malowe greatleſe ariſtarchus famouſe grāmarien whiche corrected bookes homere tryeng verſes verſes counterfayt therfore vſe call hym ariſtarchus ſharpe co • rectour mennes workes ariſtides noble man athene playne iuſt dealing well deedes wordes hadde ſurname gyuen hym ryghtuous iuſte readeth mannes lyfe lyues plutarche ſhall thinke hym folowed coūſaylour gouernour vnder prynce ariſtippus philoſopher whiche fyrſt dyd put principall good thynge pleaſaunt mocions mynde pryncipall yll thinge gryefe ariſtocratia fourme gouernaunce weale publike rule moſte vertue ariſtolochia herbe wherof two kyndestone called longe round rounde hath leues facion like yuy ſomwhat rounder wherin ſharpe ſoft odoure floure white lyke lytle bonet vpon redde knoppe rootes rounde many longe ariſtolochia hath lenger leues ſmall braunches purple floure ſtynketh whan ſpryngeth facyon peare rote therof long greatneſſe mannes fyngar bothe beare beryes lyke caper within box coloure whiche bytter ſtynkynge ariſtomenes man meſſene whiche called iuſtiſsimus moſte iuſte man whan dead founden haue hart heary ariſtophanes famous poete wrate comedy wherin taūted dyd fauoure eloquent moch myrth workes ariſtophorū diſſhe wherin meate borne dyner ariſtoteles philoſopher quintylyane writeth wyſe whatte ſaye ariſtotle whome wote whither maye iudge excellent knowlege thinges abundaunce wrytynge huſband ſo excelled whan deade ſhe cauſed harte dried veſſelle golde pou • er lyttell lyttell dranke vppe ſayenge theyr two harte ſhulde neuer departe ſonder ſhe thought mought made noo worthye atractilis herbe hauing longe ſtemme rough long leaues growyng toppe reſidue without leaues toppe full prickes yelowe floure woman wonte make ſpyndelles ſtalkes therof atricapilla byrde blacke fethers leanneſſe atrophus hath affecte atropos one fatall lady whyche fayned breake threde lyfe ſomtyme put neceſſitte dethe atta gothe ſo ſoles fete ſwepeth grounde rather walketh attagen attagena byrd whiche foūd ionia delycate hathe fethers ſondry colour beynge large alwaye ſyngynge • chatteringe whan taken maketh noyſe ſemeth haue voic • ar deceiued take hym woodcocke attalica toga gowne manne ¶a ante v avarus coueytous money aucupare ſermonem alicuius harken take hede one ſayth audin tu hereſt thou audire bene haue good name audire male haue yll name audiens dicto redy doo commaunded commaundement obedyent▪ audienciam facere commaunde make ſylence doo wihche cryers place iuſtyce auello auulſi auellere plucke awaye vyolence auellere ſe meretrice withdrawe hym go away force harlotts auenaria kynde graſſehoppes appers nat vntyll corne rype auentinus hylle rome auerni people france callid auergnes auernus loke campani • whyche dedicate vnto pluto kyng hell •• ſuppoſed entrie paſſage helle auerſus um ſtraunge vnacquaynted vergilius auertere ab aliquo loco lette prohybyte one enter aueruncus god whiche putteth awaye euylle aufero abſtuli auferre take away terentius aufer te hinc gette henſe aufer te domum gette home plautus auferas iurgium leaue thy chydynge auferre litem gette action proceſſe lawe maiore mulcta mulcta • quam li • em auferunt plautus ruden maketh ſpende may wynne ſuite aufer nugas leaue theſe trifelynges leaue mockes auferre petitionem haue thynge aſkethplautus cur tuo arbitratu dum auferam ab te id quod peto euen ye wyll ſoo maye haue thynge aſke demaunde auferre pignora take dyſtreſſe gage plautus aſina auferre tacita make oone confeſſe thynge ſecrete suſpendas potius quam tacita haec auferas thou mayſt rather hange thanne make confeſſe ſecrete terentius andria auferre inultum goo quyte without punyſhement ergo pretium ob ſtultitiam fero ſed inultū nun quam auferet well rewarded folyſhenes yet ſhall go quyte away without punyſhement cic tuſc queſt 3 ennius auferri ſibi vexed mynde frome hym ſelfe augifico augeo augere auxilia make newe hoſte diſcomfyte auguratus dygnitie theym whiche augures whome colledge rome nowe prieſtes cathedrall church augurium dyuination tellynge thinges whiche ſhall happen ſpecially flyght voyces byrdes cicero • l murena auguror ari idem quod augure auguror opiniōe ſuppoſe myn opinyon auguſta caeſaria cytie spayne vppon ryuer iberus auguſta emerita cytie portugall auguſta vindelicorum goodly beautyfulle citie germanye nowe callydde awſbourghe auguſtalis ale emperours palayce pauyllyon auguſtus place conſecrate full maieſtie honour alſo name addicion gyuen emperours auiatius auiaria ſhe hath charge kepynge pultrie wildfoule may alſo vſed pultar whiche ſelleth pultrie auiarium place pultrie kept alſo buſſhes ſette byrdes haunte ſytte auide affectuouſly couetouſly ardantly great deſyre auidis moribus excedynge couaytous appetite auiditas deſyre thynge couetyſe ardant affection auidus cibi hungryeterent auilla lambe lately yeaned auius uia uium plaut vergil saluſt wherby paſſage waye auius gothe way aula old writer vſid olla pot aulula lyttell potte wherof cometh aulularia comedye plautus wherein declared couetous mynd one whiche hydde money potte thynkyng noo man knewe hit hym ſelfe yet deceyued aulicotia boyled meate aulicus courtyar aulicus ca cum courtsueton nerone aulicus apparatus courtely apparayle moſt proprely apparayle pryncis aulis lidis lyttelle countraye ſhyre boeotia grece alſo great cytie hauen princis grece aſſemblyd conſpired togyther diſtruction troy aulon name mountayne citie calabria growethe excellente good wynes alſoo two cyties oone macedonia cilicia aul • ſhaulmes waytes auleticus playeth beſt ſha • wayte auocare animum withdrawe mynde thynge auocamentum paſſetyme recreation withdraweth mynde heuyneſſe melancholy aurata fyſhe ſee ſuppoſe gylte heed hath foreheed thinge congelate water ſhyneth lyke golde alſo hath ſet • lyke checke • wherwith hathe ben harde fyſhers night cruſhe cockyls ſuche lytell ſhell fyſhes wheron fedeth terentius andria aures arrigere lyfte vppe eares attentyuely cicero saluſt cicero ꝓ g •• la • co plautus
