auribus cap • ſpolia harken beare away ſacrefies ſecrete counſayle auribus dare flatter ſpeake whiche ſhall content man eare auribus aequiſsimis alicuius uti fauorably harde one apulcius auribus prouehi caried eares proprely vſed wyl declare beinge iourney one delyte ſo moch cōmunication fele labour payne going riding may ſay auribus prouehimur hering hym paynes relieued heryng talke iorney ſemeth ſhorte abbreuiate auricularius um pertayning eares auricularis confeſsio cōfeſſion made ſecretly prieſtis auricularis▪ idem aurigo ſicknes callid yelow iaundiſe aurilegus hath ſtollen golde auripigmentum aurum coronatium golde gathered people make crownes ſende emperours vyctories plaut mercator auſcultabitur wyll ye byd hym auſcultare alicui obeye one commaundement auſcultare inter ſeſe whyſter oone nothers • auſim ſis ſit put audeam auſitis contray callid alſo hus iob dwellyd auſonium italy auſones anciēt kynges italy auſum auſus preſumptuous enterpriſe plautus peria auſpicium liquidū manifeſt ſigne token auſpicia optimum token good lucke plautus aui auſpicio malo ylle lucke ylle tyme nae ego edepol ueni huc auſpicio malo camme hither ylle time vnhappy vnlucky fortune broughte byther auſpico ſeke thing diuinatiō auſpicatus ta tum honourably enterpriſedquintilia auſpicató happyly auſtrum ſpoke whele aut certe leaſt quo enim vno uincebamur victa graetia id aut illi beganne countray doo inhabyte whyche name gyuen athene autodidactus lernith without maſter owne ſtudy automaton thynges without lyfe whyche ſeme moue ſelfes may appere olde horologe ymages whiche vice moue autopyros breade cleane wheate without mixture ſauing lyttell leuen author • liuius paulus inrecōſultꝰ ci ver plautus cur terentius prolog andri plautus poenu fyrſte inuenter maker thyng alſo digniſsima barris woldeſt thou haue woman arte worthy blacke tethe baſan countray beyond ryuer iordane iudea diuyded two trybes whyche may interpreted moſte fertile fatte martialis baſcanda certayn ninus ſignifieth ſonne alſo ryuer syria hath ſande nature glaſſe whiche caſteth vppe alſo torneth mettall commeth glaſſe bembina towne foreſt called nemaeus bembinatus towne woode benacus great lake lumbardy bene accipere aliquem entreate one well entertayne hym bene acceptus well entertayned plautus bene agitur thynge wel done bene ambulato god bene audire well ſpoken bene conuenire inter co agreed welle gether plinius bene cogitare de aliquo haue good opinion one plautus pſeud plautus trinum plau • bene curare aetatem lyue pleaſantly bene hercle denuncias thou tellyſt good tydynges benedico dixi dicere prayſe ſay well benedicé aduerbe ſignifieng prayſing ſaying wel cum illiciebas ad te blande et benedice whan thou dyddiſte trayne vnto pleſant wordes praiſynge benefacio cere well benefactum well done benefacta benefytes pleaſures beneficiū benefite pleſure good torne beneficentia onelye lyberalitie gyuing money poſſeſſions like thynges alſo helpynge man counſayle ſolicitation labour plautus rude plautus epidic bene ferre gratiam pleaſure one bene habere behaue hym well bene hoc habet matter commeth well paſſe bene longus ſermo longe tale bene magnus great bene manè tymely bene mereri pleaſure one bene multi many bene nummatum marſupium purſe wel ſtored money bene nummatus homo well monyed man bene ſuccesſit came well paſſe bene • ale farewell dowe bene ualere good helthe bene uertāt di • god turne good pray god brynge well paſſe bene uiuere make good chere beneuolens beneuolent loueth well nother benigna terra grounde fertile benigne aduerbe whiche ſignifieth iutice agaynſt ill men defended contray longe agaynſte outwarde hoſtilitie laſt towne taken people fleinge awaye carienge ſuche treaſure went quietly towne leuyng ſubſtance behynde hym whan demaunded bomolochus common ſcoffar ſuſteyneth vyllanie gette money alſo taken boye ſtode aulters end ſtele away candels bona caduca goodes theym damned goodes eſcheted bona dea ſhe ſome callyd fatuá fauna varro writeth lyfe neuer man ſee huſbād herde hir named bonae aedes ſubſtanciall houſe bona dicere reporte well bona fide dicere ſay truely playnly bona par parte bona uerba quaeſo ſay well pray die bye oyle oliue good chepe ſell agayne dere orels bye oyle dayes ſell againe redy money caecus morbus ſikneſſe hid may diſcerned caeci haemorroides emoraudes pile whiche within foundement appere caecum ueſtigia one may ſe way rydeth goeth caecum uallum trenche tyme warre pyght priuily ſharpe ſtakes hydde brake buſhes caecum inteſtinum bowel cometh ryghte ſyde poynt houkle bone goeth left ſyde binas de bidientes accordyng cuſtome ſacrificed two hoggrelles caelatus ta tum gra ••• caeleſus te et hoc caeleſte heuen heuēly caelibaris haſta ſtaffe iauelyn ben body one whiche called gladiatores ſlayn ſtaffe heade mayden newe maried hempe ſtriken ſygnifiyng lykewyſe ſtaffe ſtycked faſte body hym ſlayne ſo ſhulde ſhe ſtycke faſt ioyned hym maried caeloſtomia vyce ſpeache one ſpeketh inwardely cantata cantito tare ſynge often plautus trinūmo cantare monyſſhe exhorte haec dy noctes que tibi canto ut caueas exhort daye nyght thou mayſte beware cantatio ſyngynge cantator ſynger capere rationem fynde meane rationem coepi ut amanti obſequerer patrem non offenderem founde mean pleaſe louer withſtandyng dyſpleaſed father alſo knowe cauſe whyterent heautont scio tibi eſſe hoc grauius multo ac durius cui fit uerum ego haud minus aegré patior id qui neſcio nec rationem capio niſi quod tibi bene ex animo uolo knowe wel thynge toucheth hit moche diſpleaſant greuous yet greuith leſſe money delyueraunce thynge uero ci bru inquam tibi ego brute non ſoluā niſi prius te cauero amplius eo nomine neminem cuius petitio ſit petiturum truely ſayde brutus wyll pay excepte haue fyrſt circumcidaneus um cutte rounde circūciſitum muſtum wine grape preſſed taken ſame grape cut newe preſſed sueton de claris rhetoribus ser sul ad ciceronē circumciſe agere make oration pecis without comming purpoſe circumcirca aboute circumcurſo run hither thither circundo dare enuyronne compaſſe aboute paulus de iudicata vlp de iudiclis circunduco duxi ducere lead one alſo abolyſſhe put aſyde acte quod ſi qui edictum peremptorium impetrauit abſit die cognitionis tunc circūducendum erit edictum peremptorium yf hath optayned paremptorie decree abſent daye whan matter ſhuld determined peremptorie decree dyſſolued abolyſhed plautus pſeud plautus ibidem plautus capt circūducere ſommetyme deceyue cautelles circumducere aliquem argento get one money falſehode circumductus ta tum ledde circumductio deceyte circumferre ſe go braggynge ſtreetes vergilius circumflecto tere turne hither thyder circumfundo dere caſte water lycour aboute vergili circumfuſus um gathered people whan deſyre ſe thyng ſomtime wrapped lyke adder ſerpent plin de uitis illuſtr circumlino annoynte aboute circummiſſus um ſente aboute circummunio ire enuyron ſtrongely fortifie walles men cicero circumpedes houſe lyke thynge plautus mili plautus cogitat curas thynketh matter cogitaté aduyſedly cogitatum idem cogere oues putte vp ſhepe ſtable folde cogere ordinem ſette order cohaereo cohaeſi haerete ioyned cleaue thynge alſo come paſſe nuptiae non cohaerent mariage come nat paſſe alſo agree togyther cohaeres ioyntelye heyre nother cohibere retayne kepe hym ſelfe cic de se cohibere intra limen kepe within doores plautus milite plautus mer • ator ter cohibere filium kepe vnder ſonne cohibere ſe moderate hym ſelfe cohibitus ta tum lette refrayned cohors alſo company ſeruantes aboute noble man colina culina kytchen collabefactari teſtula banyſhed citie lotte ſhelles vſid athene se oſtraciſmus collacteus ſucketh ſame breſt ſame tyme collatitius um whyche gathered brought gyther collaudo prayſe collegium company haue equall authoritie alſo companye men whiche one myſterie crafte collibet collubet collibuit collibitum eſt collibére plautus amph lyke pleaſe vtcun que animo collibitum eſt meo euen pleaſeth lyketh colligere ueſtem tucke vp garment colloco care ſette place plaut • lul plautus amph collocare ſe arborem klim vp tree colocare aliquem ſoporem ſtryke one ſuche wyſe amaſed lieth ſlepe ſpeake hit ſhortly laye one aſlepe ſtroke plautus merca colloces te otium drawe eaſe collocatus ta tum put ſet ſome place collocupleto tare enryche colloqui aliquem ſpeake one colloqui alicui deuyſe talke one colloquor queris qui talke one talke togyther colluuiaris porcus hogge walloweth myre hath meate giuen hym colludo dere play one togither colluſor oris playfelowe plautus capt collus idem quod collum collybus money receyued exchaunge banke menne whiche goo ſtraunge countrays delyuering money realme receyue moche coyne commeth collybiſtes collybiſte deliuereth money uenit ye ſcantely departed yeſterday whan trebatius came plautus pſeud terentius andria commonere aliquem officium ſuum aduertiſe one ought commonere aliquem remembre one thynge commonſtro ſhewe thyng cophinus baſket copio gather moche gether copiola ſome plenty copia alſo ayde copiam dare gyue power lycenceterent heautont alſo gyue occaſion copia eſt nam apud patrem tua amica tecum ſine metu ut ſit copia eſt ibidem thou mayſte nowe brynge paſſe thy wench may thy father without drede copia eſt may moughtterentius p • • ego eum incidi infelix lo cum ut neque eius ſit ittendi nec retin endi copia vnhapily come poynte maye neyther leaue kepe hir copia uix fuit eum adeundi great difficultie peyn mought come vnto copia cuntandi non eſt tibi plautus epidic plautus capt plautus epidico plautus • milite pli epi thou haſte noo leyſure tarye copia eſt tibi magi thou mayſt eaſily copia nulla eſt tibi illo canne nothyng helpe copiam efficere alicui fynde meanes one may come copiam facere ſpeke prechvergili horatius crepidatus weareth ſlyppers crepidula lyttell ſlyppar crepitare dentibus craſhe tethplautus ruden plautus amphit crepitat mihi uenter bealy courleth crepuit foris doore craked criſpus hath curlyd heare criſta kreſte thynge growyng heade foule beaſte cockes combe fethers heade byrde callyd coppe crociatus ta tum coloured lyke ſaffron crocito tare croke like rauen crow crocitus noyſe rauen crowe maketh callyd crokynge crocitatio idem crocomagma matis duſte refuſe saffron cronia feaſtes saturne cruciabilitas cruciatus turment affliction cruci dare aliquem hange oneplautus milite crucifigo fixi gere crucyfie crucio tourment cruda poma fruites rype cruſculum lyttell ſmall legge cruſtum alſo morcel bread meatevergili crux ſygnifieth maner tourment c ante v cvcurbitula lyttell gourde cuppe wherwith bloode drawen man whan ſcarified cucuma veſſell braſſe tynne facioned lyke cucumer wherwith bathe fylled emptied cudetur faba blaame ſhall layde cuiuſmodi facion maner plautus menech oicer procluen cicer pro roſcio cuiuſmodi homines erunt maner men ſhall cuiuſmodicun que mater ſir ſoo euer mother ſhe cuiuſ que modi vereor enim cuiuſ que modi e roſci ne ita hunc uidear voluiſſe ſetuare ut tibi omnino non pepercerim feare ſo euer ſtate thou arte roſ leſt ſhall thought wolde ſo excuſe defende hym foraſmoche haue nat ſpared saluſti catelin cuiuſcun que modi genus hominum maner ſortes men culcitrula lyttell fether bedde feſtus culcitula lyttell ſtaffe culeus amonge romaynes greatteſt meaſure receyueth twenty meaſures callyd amphora whyche amounteth two thouſand eight hundred foure pounde meaſure euery pound beinge twelue ounce alſo ſacke lether wherinto whiche hadde ſlayne father mother ſowen alſo put alyue cocke serpent ape throwen al togither riuer tyber punyſhment paricides murderer parentes plautus capt culpa carere nat offende culpam commereri committe offence culpam alterum conferre lay blame nother culpito tare blame often culpo pare blame cululus lyttell chalyce cuppe erth whiche byſhops vſed ſacrifice plautus paenulo cum nam cum ſedulo munditer no habemus uix aegre amarorculos inuenimus though appoynt v neuer ſo kleanly yet vneth fynde louers cum dicto forthewith ſoone ſpoken terentius hecyra cum maxume moche cumulatus ta tum augmented cumulatè abundantly vergilius cunabula alſo taken begynnyng thynges cunctanter ſlowely ſofte fayre cunctatio contatio taryenge cunctus ta tum togther cunilago kynde ſauerye cupiens deſyreth thynge cupiens tui eſt loueth hartyly cupienter great deſyre cupitus ta tum deſyred cupreſſus cypreſſe tree cupreſsinus na num cypre tree curiata comitia aſſemblyes people place iudgement matter varyaunce curio alſo curateliuius hathe ſpirituall charge paryſhe curionatus offyce curate curionium money giuen curate doinge offyce curmundulla peares delycate hauing ſo thynne parynges men dydde eate vnparyd curare care thynge take heedeterent andria dilygent aboute thyng cura ut valeas looke thy helthe curaſti probé thou haſte done euery thynge well curare aedes take hede houſeplautus terent heauto nothynge loſte curare aliena meddell mennes buſyneſſe curare amicos plautus sticho plautus trinūmo entertayne frendes acquayntaunce curare fidem kepe promyſe curare munus ſuum offyce curabo illi pecuniam wylle prouyde ſhall haue money curabitur ſhall prouyded curatus ta tum done dilygence curatus good poynt ſtate curatio charge curatio mea eſt plautus poenu myn offyce charge currens runneth currentem incitare exhorte ſette forwarde hym owne courage well diſpoſed thynge curſim al ſpede ſpedyly curſura courſe cuticula thynne ſkynne cutiones whyche ſellynge make many price come poyntefeſtus cuturnium veſſell whiche wine poured ſacrifices ¶c ante cyanus blewe flowre growynge amonge corne callyd bluebottell cyathiſſo ſyppe quafte halues cyathus xii parte meſure callyd sextarius whyche ſuppoſed moche commonlye temperate man dyd drynke one draught rede sextario cyborium kind appuls alexandria cydarum bote cynodontae dogges tethe whiche doo growe latter age cyperus babylonicus galyngale cypſili byrdes callyd ſwalowes cyrnij people ile cors cyſthus kynde yuye cytinus floure damnas dare pay damage damnum facere ſuffre damage haue loſſe damnatus condemned damnatior worthy deathe daniſta vſerer daniſticus ca cum pertaynynge vſery plautus trucu dapſilis lectus excellent good holſom ante e plautus 〈…〉 de nocte abijt went away night de nocte uigila • e wake ī night de die day ergo ne una orationis par de die dabitur mihi ſhal nat ſuffred ſpeake one lyttell worde day 〈1 paragraph〉 de die uiuere euerye daye daye daye lyue plautus per • plautus bacch plautus monech cicero cicero terentius hecyra plautus moſtel terent eunucho plautus capt terent heauto plautus trucu plautus epidico de meo good de tuo thy good de mea ſententia counſayle de illis verbis caue tibi beware howe thou ſpekeſt ſuche wordes de imperio decertatur fyghte empire chiefe rule de manu manum hande hande de filia te adij comme ſpeake doughter de meo exemplo aedificet lette hym buylde accordynge platte de iſta • te amo loue ſake de compacto agrement de induſtria purpoſe de integro efteſoones beginning de improuiſo auenture vnſought vnlooked de hath ben accuſtomed de nihilo nihil eſt iraſci folye angry nothynge de praefacili exores thou ſhalte lyghtely opteyne plautus de proximo ſenex olde man dwelleth hereby de repenté ſodaynly de ſubito idem deam bulatio walkynge forth abrode houſe debilito tare make feble weake deblatero terare ſpeake foolyſſhelyfe •••• non mar babble rebukeully decaluo make balde decaphorus lytter borne tenne menci ad plinius decedere gyue place decedere itinere tourne waye ſome purpoſeplautus ci ver decedere uia go way decedere de ſuo ti liuius chaunge cuſtome decedere inſtituto ſuo ci ver liuius otherwiſe wonte decedere officio agaynſte duetie duetieterent adelph cic • 1 decede • nihil de ſumma ſhall nothynge minyſhed decedere dye decedi haue place way gyuencicero de ſenectute haec enim ipſa ſunt honorabilia quae uidentur leuia que communia ſalutari appeti decedi aſſurgi deduci reduci thoſe thynges ar honourable whiche ſeme ſmall effecte commune awayted ſued vnto haue way giuen ryſen vnto brought court brought agayne home decem number tenne decemuiri tenne men one authoritie suche rome ſoone ceaſſed haue kynges authoritie gather lawes alſo make lawes laſte conſpired haue perpetuall authoritie fynallye therfore depoſed euer decemuiratus dignitie offyce decemuiri colu li 4 decenus na num doſen decies tenne tymes decennalis le tenne yeres decennium ſpace tenne yeres decenter comelye ſeemelyterent necyra hit conuenyent decermina thynges pulled away making thynges cleane decernere purpoſeplautus moſtel decernere ſyxe thouſande fyue hundred foure ſcore ſeuen pounde tenne ſhyllynges plinius varro decliuis ue whiche redy fall decliuis aetate falle • age decollare fayle decolorus ū lackyng colour yl colorid decoloratus ta tum idem decoxit domino ſuo foetura increaſe cattayle came lyttell aduauntage vnto mayſter decore honeſtly decortico care barke tree decotes thredebare garmentes garmē te worne vttermoſte decumbo bere lye downe daecures olde writer vſed decuriones decuriatio making knightes captain ti liuius de bell macedonico lib 10 decu • rere iuſte decuſsis ten hole partes alſo peces equally cutte ouer diuiſions tymber ſawen equall partes decuſſatim euen porcions cutte dedecet honeſt conuenient dedecoro rare diſhoneſt dedecus dedecoris dyſhoneſtie dedignatio dyſdayne deditus ta tum gyuen rendred dedita opera pourpoſe owne conſente deducere riuos tourne ryuer deducere vocem ſpeake ſmalle deducere abate ſomme defaecatus ta tum fyned cleane lye dregges wyne whyche nat troublyd weery defeſ • u ſum idem defectus ū lacketh thing defectio rebelliō departing one captayn go alſo lacke defaut plautus perſa pli pan cicer defigere aliquem colaphis gyue oone cuffe eare beate one furlong beinge cxxv fete diacodion ſyrope made heedes popye water dibaplia purple twyſe dyed terentius phorm plautus auiui terentius phormi ci ver dicam impingere bryng action againſt one laye agaynſt one charge dicam ſcribere alicui enter action agaynſte one dichas meaſure two palmes viii fyngers dicare operam ſuam offre ſeruyce dicere nummos promyſe money saluſti hiſto dicere ex animo ſpeke man thinketh dicere ex tempore make oration without ſtudy alſo ſpeake vnaduyſedly dicere alſo call thynge name plautus curgul ibidem dicaſsis dicas dice dic dictamen thyng writen man inſtruction dictare rationem yelde accompte plautus amph dictatum mynute gyuen one ſo nother write letter dictito tell thynge ofte didragma coyne whiche value viii money callyd seſterciil whiche oure moneye two olde thyrſte pli epi differre vadimonium gyue one longer day apparaunce differre famam alicui ſprede one name abroode differri ſoo vexed mynde man wotteth nat doo plautus ciſtell difficultas difficultie piece plautus • acch diuidia buſynes trouble variance ¶d ante plautus capt idē aul amphit dare ruborem make aſhamed dare inſidias deceyue one dare iusiurandum take othe lego gyue teſtament laſte wyll dare malum alicui one ſhrewd turne dare manus yelde hym ſelf vanquiſhed dare mancipio delyuer warrantiſe suo periculo emat qui eam mercabitur mancipio ne que promitret plautus p ••• ne que quis quam dabit wyll haue let hym bye owne peryll man ſhall promyſe delyuer warrantiſe dare mutnum lende dare vitio diſprayſe plautus 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 danunt idem quod dant gyue datu meo gyfte datarius um whiche gyue datatim ludere toſſe frome one nother men playe tenys doctor teacheth doccus tymber piece dodrans alſo ix meaſures callyd cyath • alſo ix inch length bredth dogmariſtes folowethe nother man cicero de diuinatiōe tibullus domuitio departynge home mitus ta tum made tame ſubdewed vanquyſſhed domator idem quod domitor dominus alſo owner domina lady maiſtreſſe dominatus tus domynation authorytie ouer mayſterſhyp domus ſometyme temple churche alſo familye kynrede alſoo mannes countrey alſo neſte byrdes donaticae corona garlandes olde tyme worne playes dormire vttamuis aurem terent thinges chaunceth expetit tuam aetatem illud facere thyne age requyreth expetere alſo pourchaceplautus ruden mirum quin tuum ius meo periculo expetam meruayle ſhall pourchaſe thy ryghte great danger alſo redoūde tourne nam deum non par uidetur facere plautus amphit delictum ſuū ſuam que culpam expetere mortalem ut ſinat▪ nat ſyttynge god doo offence faute ſhoulde redounde mortall perſon plautus ſin annum yere bonis amonge good men coenam ſupper conſpectum aſpice loke diem uiuere lyue without carynge morowe numerato habere redy hande partem thy parte age ſis tu partem nunc iam hunc delude que amplexare hanc goo nowe thy parte deceyue hym hardely take vnto cicero pedem euery foote ſe ternis nummis pedem tecum tranſegiſſe dicebat ſayde bargayned thre penny fote euery fote cicer pro lege poteſtatem eſſe vnder rule pleaſure one praeſentia preſent tyme primis aboue thynges procliui maye lyghtely eaſyly done promptu eſt eaſy knowe apparaunte plautus pſeud feſtus inanis accedit commeth withoute bryngynge thynge hym inciens woman nygh tyme trauaile chylde inclareo uel inclareſco ere knowen men inconſultè without counſaile vnaduiſedly incontinens chaſte kepeth hym one woman folowing agricola approuyng diligēce makynge true conference betwene hym ouer beinge welle lerned hebrue tunge conſequētly holy ſcripture trieng ſtudiouſely poyſes meſures hebrues pertaining hath
